author: {'steamid': '76561197976300116', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1323, 'last_played': 1627289123}
review:
Ужасный vr порт прекрасной игры.

Имеем капитальные технические проблемы и судя по форуму они происходят на очень разном железе. Пройдя Alex на высоких настройках, Talos я играл на минималках и 75% render scale и всё равно были фрейм дропы и рассинхроны кадров и это на vulkan, на dx вообще не играбельно.

В игре нет опции играть сидя, есть опция скалирования мира в диапазоне 50-100%, которая должна заменять сидячий режим, но всё равно ощущения странных масштабов мира не покидает если её юзать.

Часто возникают проблемы с поставить что то в определённое место или взять, возможно это из-за изменения масштабов мира, но на поздних этапах где есть загадки на время это адски бесит.

Проходил эту версию только из-за планов перепройти игру, и уж лучше бы перепрошёл плоскую, а зная о проблемах с vr версией даже не стал бы её покупать.

Техническая всратость vr версии выглядит очень странной, т.к. Serious Sam 3VR сделанный на предыдущей версии движка игрался без проблем.

author: {'steamid': '76561199130954151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2859, 'last_played': 1630437719}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995587898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1615592758}
review:
Played on Valve Index

Wow. This game has really been amazing so far but this port to VR is simply revolting. Walking, picking up items, entering the gate-puzzles, interacting with ladders, all of it takes twice as long in VR than if you were to just play the original version of the game. This just feels a like a cash-grab with none of the attention to detail put into the original. This is not meant to be a fun experience, just to cash in on VR-Gimmicks.

Here is a solid piece of evidence for how bad the Port is based on the Steam achievements Global stats:
54% of players actually beat the first 1/4 of the standard game (The Land of Death Achievement)
9% of players actually beat the first 1/4 of the VR game (The Land of Death Achievement)
^^There is a reason that only 1/6 of the player base reaches this checkpoint in the the VR edition. Its because they get frustrated with the port and quit.

This is probably the best puzzle game I've played since Portal 2, but do yourself a favor and pick up the standard edition if you want to have a good time with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040922643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1624173578}
review:
DO. NOT. BUY. THIS. GAME. 

This game is absolutely beautiful!  I love the puzzles and the little bits of story I've uncovered are fascinating!  

A bug in the game prevents moving beyond the first area.  You reach an elevator, push the button and it just *buzzes* but never moves the elevator. 

I've found multiple forums talking about it (including the community board here on steam).  Croteam has known about it and apparently not bothered to fix it since 2019.  The advice I've found is to just try pushing the button from different angles until it registers. I've tried pretty much every angle, depth of push, and quickness of push imaginable with zero luck.  I emailed them for support 10 days ago with no response at all.  Steam refuses to even consider a refund because I've played for more than two hours (most of that time spent backtracking thinking I must have missed something to unlock the elevator and they immediately close every ticket I send them asking them to communicate with me about WHY I'm asking for a refund. 

Do. Not. Buy. This. Game.
At least, not for VR.  
If you want to play it, look at the standard PC version instead (the two versions, VR and flatscreen are sold as completely separate products unlike almost every single other VR/flatscreen game available on Steam)

author: {'steamid': '76561198201386637', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1622790198}
review:
I was going to try this out as a fun VR experience as I really wanted something puzzle-like to just wander around in VR to get a handle of it. I have decided playing this game on VR as my first playthru would be a bad idea with how difficult it is JUST to get the game to look right. The flashing green problem is a common visual glitch on the VR edition, and while there are fixes for it, and I was able to fix it, I came upon new and more frustrating graphical glitches that have existed since this games VR release. Everything has this red and brown muted tinge to it. And there are solutions to this problem that work for people. I have tried these solutions and the problems persist for me. I cannot fix it. Graphics are not everything but when you're in a VR helmet and you want to get immersed into something and youre very aware of how the game doesn't look as its supposed to..it kind of ruins the fun.

I will be playing this on my PS4 instead. A real shame. I do not recommend this game unless they finally address these graphical problems.

review: I have not played the regular version but I thoroughly enjoyed the VR version.  Great story, very well done VR implementation that doesn’t feel like a port, decent graphics, and fun puzzles. The puzzles range from easy to a few head scratchers but I was never stuck too long or frustrated. I happily spent 25 hours + in VR. I felt very slight discomfort if I cranked the movement speed to max and even then it was playable. At the default setting I had no issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198377255207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3731, 'last_played': 1644024514}

author: {'steamid': '76561198384321457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1639872180}
review:
Great port in nearly every regard, but there is no jump button on the Rift S. Forums say that it works in an older version, but I have no idea how to downdate.

EDIT: a lot of the forums say to "downdate" or something to an older version, but I couldn't figuire out how.

Instead, they say to launch it thru oculus instead of SteamVR

not sure where I found this, but here's the fix I used: type [+vrapi Oculus] into the launch properties, minus the brackets.

it enables jumping with either of the upper buttons on the Rift S remotes. Note it does remove pausing, but that's not a terrible issue as you can pause with the escape button on the keyboard, and the port comes with a full "2D" GUI.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059470346', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1605465482}
review:
Jednym z większych problemów obecnego VR jest brak dużych gier albo takich, które mają jakiś budżet. Talos nie jest grą stricte pod VR, ale został na gogle sportowana i działa bardzo dobrze.

Talos to zbiór zagadek logicznych o różnym stopniu trudności, po których przejściu dostajemy puzzle rodem z tetrisa, które później służą nam do odblokowywania kolejnych etapów. Gra nie różnie się absolutnie niczym od wersji bez VR w tytule. Również narracja została nienaruszona, dalej jest to filozoficzna opowieść w dodatku w jeżyku polski wraz z dubbingiem co zbyt często się nie zdarza i warto to docenić, że Polska wersja nie zaginęła przy portowaniu. Dla osób wrażliwych gra posiada poruszanie skokowe. Nie jest to teleportacja, gdyż wszelkie zagrożenia chcące nam zrobić krzywdę zauważą, że będziemy przechodzić przez ich pole widzenia i zaatakują nas. Nie da się też w ten sposób skakać po wszystkim jak kozica górska. Dla mniej wrażliwych na ruch można poruszać się na gałce analogowej.

Nie ma tu zbyt wielu rzeczy, które dawałyby nam się bawić, w sensie cegłówek, liści i temu podobnych. Wszystko co można ruszyć jest ściśle związane z mechaniką gry. Jeśli coś można podnieść, znaczy, że jest nam potrzebne. Nie ma tu zapychaczy, ani rzeczy, które nas rozpraszają. Ani przez chwilę nie miałem potrzeby by sprawdzić, czy ten, czy tamten przedmiot da się podnieść, a zwykle gdy w gry VR gram, to jest to pierwsze co robię. Interfejs też jest znakomicie przemyślany, gdyż prawie go nie ma. Na rękach mamy zebrane elementy. Jedynie klikając przycisk otwierający menu psuje ten efekt, gdyż dostajemy brzydkie czarne tło z napisami, które kompletnie psują nam klimat.

Jeśli graliście w Talosa wcześniej, to wersja VR jest wam całkowicie zbędna. Nie jest to doświadczenie wywracające życie do góry nogami, jeśli tak jak ja z Talosem nie mieliście wcześniej kontaktu, to warto wersję VR rozważyć

author: {'steamid': '76561198275971640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2091, 'last_played': 1527097951}
review: must play game vr or non vr

author: {'steamid': '76561197968241185', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1709226483}
review: The best VR remasters I've ever played. the graphics are stunning, and the game is well optimized, with a 1080 Ti and a generic ryzen I was able to play on all ultra settings on 125% res on a tethered Quest 2 on more or lress 90 FPS. The art, the music, and the game are all stunning, and I can't wait to get my full fix out of this game that I enjoyed so much on the pancake version. I'll be sure to play Road to Gehenna, also: you forget the more medium to hard puzzles after a few years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151342049', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1115, 'last_played': 1618867114}
review:
I strongly recommend this game if you ever were into puzzle games, they are so much better in VR!

The cool thing about this game is that even if you're stuck you just leave the puzzle and go on and on the next day you always smash it. Very satisfying.

The game has three endings, however one is boring and one is reachable only for (what I think) hardcore players since it's extremely hard without passtroughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044887443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1634461752}

It feels like a dream

author: {'steamid': '76561197961017729', 'num_games_owned': 3005, 'num_reviews': 3428, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1709519112}
review:
[b]The Talos Principle VR is not a good VR game.[/b] It's another well functioning, but standard cookie cutter VR addon to a game that is already long and boring. I mean, it's no Portal. It certainly doesn't come close to having that games personality, but it's on the same wavelength. I like the aesthetic, and I'm generally hip to the concept. The big draw to The Talos Principle is the philosophical story, and the mystery and all that.

To earn that you have to do endless amounts of these boring puzzles that are all kinda similar to each other. [i]Does anyone else get a weird cellphone game progression type vibe with these puzzles?[/i] Still, you might like that, and the game is very peaceful (albeit also boring), which is a positive for VR generally, but it would be a waste of time to subject yourself to this whole game on an HMD. I got through a couple worlds, but then proceeded to just read the wikia and scroll paste a few youtube playthroughs.

Ideally you'd want to play alot of this on your monitor, but surprise! You have to buy the original version for that! It's just like Skyrim or all the other Croteam games. They're reselling the whole game again with the VR addon packaged. Both titles are 40 dollars. I'm not saying they can't sell the VR game for the same price as the other one, or have to package the port as a DLC instead. This would be fine if you could play the VR version on a monitor, but if you don't have the original game, you can't, and if you do, you still have to install both games and futz with the save files! There's a chance I'm wrong, or that maybe (with mods or something) you can play the game in 2d mode without buying the original package, if so, disregard. Still, Croteam and Bethesda price gouged on their VR ports like mad, and these are games that haven't been updated in years. [spoiler] I think the whole  game world is a computer simulation, haha spoiled it, but doesn't really seem that groundbreaking anyway when your inside your own VR system, eh.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970590572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1617636775}

review: Fantástico titulo

author: {'steamid': '76561198041148954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1615774883}
review: The original game is great; the VR version is not, at least not on the Valve Index that it claims to support. Controls are very janky. Even after disabling the control that causes you to teleport when you grip the controller, which I can only assume was a mistake because nobody has ever wanted that behavior, it's still a huge pain to actually teleport where you want. I will regularly have the teleport circle in the right place, let go of the button to teleport, and jump to a completely different location. I don't know why this would be Index-specific, but people with other headsets seem to be happy so you might be ok with those. And as far as I can tell there is no way to rotate the teleport circle, which is a pretty bad omission, so get ready to constantly teleport and then rotate, over and over. Ultimately the game just doesn't adapt well to VR, too much of the game is moving around instead of interacting with the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561199063552576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3841, 'last_played': 1708553295}
review: One of the best puzzle game

author: {'steamid': '76561198013146396', 'num_games_owned': 1655, 'num_reviews': 2129, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1614854359}
review:
В плане портирования на VR - качественно, насколько это возможно. Но чисто концептуально играется сложнее обычной версии, виновата сама технология: ты жертвуешь лаконичностью своих действий в пользу погружения. Аттракцион чистой воды. Мне в обычной-то усидчивости не хватало, хоть и прошёл в итоге.
Но не идеально - в главном меню и храме один глаз почему-то начинает кривить цвета, как если на него закрытого вживую пальцем легонько надавить. Смотрится крайне неприятно.


Но оригинал мне настолько остопиздел, что я его с ноги в треш отправляю вместе с ублюдской "The witness". Не для людей это делано, а вообще непонятно, для кого.
Эта игра хоть и легче - головоломок НЕПРИЛИЧНО много. По ощущениям столько же, сколько было всратых однообразных пещер и блокпостов в "Assasins...Odyssey". Живой пример того, что всё хорошо в меру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022415153', 'num_games_owned': 969, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 1521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1521, 'last_played': 1613857606}
review: I so wish I could give a neutral review. It's good, but it's ultimately frustrating. The Talos Principle was not made for VR, Croteam did a good job porting it, but the fine placement of items in levels, as well as just the controls in general make it a frustrating experience for me.  The first 2 worlds are enjoyable though, but it just drags on too long to be an enjoyable VR experience for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198962463732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7078, 'last_played': 1622324824}
review: Excellent, atmospheric VR (Valve Index) puzzle game that has transferred well from the "pancake" version. Rendering of individual game worlds works well and each has a distinctive "look & feel"..... VR gameplay is functional, though object gripping & then dropping required strict controller accuracy (especially in action / mine / machine gun related sequences). Overall brilliant entertainment ...... now must go back to the Talos Garden and sort out that Serpent for those last few Achievements ....

author: {'steamid': '76561197970337659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1657408970}
review:
Endless Hours of puzzles. 
This is a great thinking puzzle game, the backdrop and concept is awesome. Just when I thought I had it complete and opened the first door to the elevator, and came out. It dawned on me that I had only just begun. This game has countless hours. The idea is collect tetris like pieces to open up other areas and unlock objects that will spawn in the puzzles. You can free room anywhere and go back to areas that you could not complete due to you not having the unlocked item.

The graphics are ok, I have no issues running this game on ultra with highest res but textures can still look a little  low res at times. Other than that I would highly recommend it if your big into puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999959620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2983, 'last_played': 1613346974}
review: This "game" touched me deeply.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043373833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1672517009}
review:
Il senso di meraviglia.
Il gusto dell'esplorazione in luoghi esotici di palese ispirazione antico greco/latina
La sfida nel cercare di ricomporre il puzzle che ci porterà alla comprensione.
Quel sottile senso di nostalgia e solitudine indefiniti.
Il senso dell'Esistenza.
Il tutto potenziato da un ottimo uso della VR e da una grafica di qualità.
Questo è Talos.
Chi ha amato il ciclo di Myst, e comunque a tutti coloro che si sentono a proprio agio in un contesto di esplorazione che si gusta lentamente e che ci da un input verso la riflessione su argomenti di un certo spessore è molto probabile che sarà da quest'opera ammaliato.
Altamente consigliato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063762095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 2349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1705853766}
review: J'avais fait presque la totalité du jeu en 3D. Quel plaisir de le retrouver en VR. J'avais une appréhension quant à la qualité des graphismes en VR mais je ne suis pas déçu. Un grand bravo aux développeurs d'avoir produit ça !

author: {'steamid': '76561197979928405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 2058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1315, 'last_played': 1612496600}
review:
AWESOME AND WILD IN VR!! 
The original was an amazing and fun game but in VR it takes it to a whole new level. CroTeam did an excellent job with the port to VR with the exception of grabbing and placement although that could be my crap Oculus Rift-S headset. (I review that pos headset elsewhere so no sense rehashing here)
Puzzles are just as much fun as they were in pancake game. The world looks amazing and really captures that sense of what the heck happened to everyone. 
If you want another fun VR game get their Serious Sam VR one. Its just runnning around blasting stuff but omg the worlds look so amazing.! 

Awesome Job CroTeam!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561199049803013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1611457236}
review: I was expecting something that was visually rich but was disappointed.  Maybe it gets better the deeper you get into the game but I don't have the patience  to find out.  I much prefer XING: THE LAND BEYOND

author: {'steamid': '76561198043434029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2178, 'last_played': 1611674677}
review:
While the VR could use some quality of life improvements (a height adjust setting would be appreciated for Oculus API users), I was blown away by this game. A lot of people compare it to Portal, but I would actually say it more closely resembles The Witness, if The Witness actually had a story and a purpose behind all the philosophy it throws at you. The core puzzles aren't as difficult as in The Witness, though the secret stars are there if you want an elevated challenge. You don't need the stars for the "good" ending, you just need them for an alternate ending.

This game is difficult to sell without spoilers, so I'll just say it's a first-person puzzle-based self-actualization simulator. And if that sounds even a little bit interesting to you, this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054914984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2569, 'last_played': 1611141418}
review:
Jedna z nejlepších VR her, kterou jsem hrál. Některé lokace bych bez nápovědy nedal, je to velká výzva.
Nejvíce mne zaujal příběh a filozofická témata podstaty života.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019914589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1662420637}
review: Loved the game. The puzzle solving and controls for the HTC Vive were perfect and then I got a Valve Index. Now I'm constantly fighting with the controls to do what I want. I keep teleporting when I want to grab the item in front of me. Not sure why they made the grip controls have two completely different behaviours, but the game has become too frustrating to play. I don't want to go back to using my Vive controllers just for this game so I'll likely just stop playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077750592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1611511040}

author: {'steamid': '76561198385600140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 8749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1704085257}
review: Вау, вот это игруха. Взял все дополнения и ушло времени на игру много дней (несколько месяцев) очень много. Не жалею ни капли. Я требую продолжения, срочно. 2-ю часть в студию!

author: {'steamid': '76561198883538639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1398, 'last_played': 1577906317}
review:
Played on Index:

Bought it because of the VR version. And as a puzzle game it has a interesting story to tell. 

Positives: It has a story! The graphics and sound are fine. Control is o.k. apart from a few levels where you need have very precise (almost pixel perfect) placement/timing. And in VR that is sometimes a challenge

Regarding the level of the puzzles I did need a guide to get past a few of the puzzles.

Negatives: The end felt somewhat stretched.

Verdict: Good game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198880904124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11110, 'last_played': 1581273095}
review: This has been our favorite VR game so far.  It was relaxing to play, a great story with awesome views.  Can't recommend it enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028605194', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1302, 'last_played': 1598358198}
review:
This game is absolutely outstanding. The desktop version of this game was already amazing, but experiencing it in VR was something else. The game looks good - nothing incredible though - and the puzzles are still challenging and satisfying to go through.

This easily makes it to my "Must-buy" list of VR games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043175246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1369, 'last_played': 1591224557}
review: If you like puzzle games you will love this game. If you have VR then get this version. I already owned this game far before it came out for VR and I bought it again, its worth it. It takes an already amazing game and fully immerses you in its beautiful world. The music is absolutely gorgeous and the story that unfolds while you play will keep you wanting more. One of my favorite games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992008959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1114, 'last_played': 1510752960}

author: {'steamid': '76561198074922533', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1602542412}
review:
Upfront I'm going to say: if you've played the original game to 100% completion, this is not worth full price. The VR elements are a major improvement over the original interactive controls but do not augment the gameplay in a meaningful way. However if you have not, this is a good excuse it again, with the added suffering of collecting all the stars by not just thinking outside of the box, but becoming the box itself. 

Anyway, with that out of the way I'll review this from a fresh faced never played the pancake version before perspective. The Talos Principle is not necessarily a bastion of brand new ideas or a roadmark in the progression of the gaming industry, but is instead a culmination and even perfection of already existing functionality and mechanics. Despite not being something completely new or inventive, this is an incredibly memorable experience that will leave you thinking long after you finish the game. 

Starting with the VR implementation, quite frankly it's fantastic. The range of configuration options is extreme and even a little overwhelming so definitely take some time to dial it all in for the best experience. The texture quality is exceptional, and you'll notice this especially on higher settings as your framerate absolutely tanks. I'm running a 2080 Ti and it was working out like a procrastinator two weeks before a marathon. Interactivity is fluid and intuitive, especially with the Index controllers; however using the computer terminals could become a bit of a chore and I'm sure there's a better implementation for such a large part of the game. As someone with fairly strong VR legs (I do my virtual squats), I can't vouch too reliably for motion sickness induction, though I can safely say it's not great, but not [i] horrible /[i].

I'll not be covering the main game elements as they're already reviewed to death on the pancake version of the game, so for a look into the actual gameloop quality head over there. All I'll say is, the game is an absolute masterpiece and a serious treat.

Now the hard question: worth £30? If you've never played it before, absolutely without a doubt. If you've completed it normally with no extra content, maybe wait for £20 or so (or whatever you local currency equivalent is). If you've already played it 100%, then only if you're really bored, have too much money, or just really really want to see it in VR. And to be fair, it's absolutely beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075385636', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1595685476}

review: My wife spent almost 30 hours on completing this in VR seated. She had a great experiece and she told me that the game is beautiful with a lot of great puzzles. I have not played it yet myself. But I will, in the future and then I will update the review afterwards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053701433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1578615403}
review:
I think it'd be a lot better to just play the original version - VR doesn't really add anything, and the implementation is a bit rough, leading to some minor motion-sickness and annoyances. 

Still a very interesting game though and original is a recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974131792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1599488613}
review:
Ich habe die normale Version des Spiels mehrmals durchgespielt und tue es auch immer mal wieder. Einfach ein großartiges Spiel. Weil mir es so gut gefiel habe ich es nochmal als VR Version gekauft. 

Die Umsetzung ist grauenhaft! Es war mir nicht mal möglich das erste Level (Tutorial) durchzuspielen. Ich bin maßlos enttäuscht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216520168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1670134590}
review:
面白いですが、不具合？を見つけたためレビューを書きに来ました。
自爆ボールにキューブを乗せてその上にプレイヤーが乗ると処理落ちがすごいです。
このケース最初のステージはなんとか勘でタイミングを計って対処しましたが、複雑なステージがこの先あったらイライラが募るでしょうね。
要求スペックは満たしており、そのほかの状況では問題ありません。
Wifi速度は866Mbps出ていますし、ぎゃるがんｖｒなどでは処理落ちはなく遊べています。
グラフィックなどの設定を最低にしてもなお挙動がおかしいのでバグではないかと思います。
面白いのでおすすめしたいですが、そのバグで詰む可能性も出てくるのでおすすめはしないとしておきます。
↓
クリア後のレビュー
上記バグでクリア困難になるステージは特にありませんでした。
手のひら返しでオススメとしておきます。
他1ステージだけアクションを要求される場所があったのでストレスでしたが、ボリュームがあり、かなり楽しめました。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970583381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2584, 'last_played': 1609358034}
review: This game is just awesome. The puzzles can be extremely difficult but also so satisfying. Besides that, there is enjoyment in simply spending time in the environments. I played the non-VR version, but have no regrets in paying for this. Replaying, after sufficient time to forget a little, I find actually more enjoyable than the first time around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111350544', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1577836560}
review: big think, but in vr

author: {'steamid': '76561197973296192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1682813811}
review: The locations are gorgeous in VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106150864', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1608409321}
review:
Всё тот же старый добрый Принцип Талоса. Головоломки, которые местами реально разрывают мозг, красивые декорации. Что применительно к VR, то могу сказать, что схема управления настроена весьма удобно. Есть много настроек управления поведения персонажа. Понравилось, что есть много разных опций по перемещению: и телепорт, и классическое перемещение с режимом комфорта и без него. В режиме комфорта поле зрения сужается с помощью маски и голова не кружится, без этой опции поле зрения остается как есть и у плохо тренированного человека может вызвать как головокружение, так и тошноту.
Есть и досадный баг: если в процессе игры потеряется связь со шлемом на несколько секунд, игра зависнет, а потом вылетит. Если у вас беспроводной шлем - имейте это в виду.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988057472', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1708814779}
review: Super fun puzzle game and the graphics are really good too. There's tons of game play value here as well! Worth the money if you enjoy puzzles. The ambiance on the maps are nice too!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998042773', 'num_games_owned': 978, 'num_reviews': 452, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1641752809}
review: Would I recommend it as experience? Probably. But this game being in VR makes it so much harder to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991049052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1566062829}

author: {'steamid': '76561198137683769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1705098501}
review: Una gran experiencia. Cien por cien recomendable si te gustan los puzzles.El juego tiene una extraña ambientación "tecno-mística" en decorados de la época clásica. Queda resultón y la inmersión en vr es muy buena.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993292466', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1395, 'last_played': 1600371908}
review: Excellent sci-fi philosophy story that stimulates your mind as much as the puzzles do. Really fun problem solving. VR doesn't really add to the gameplay but it adds to the story in a meta way. Really excellent puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050914695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1619223867}
review:
Colors are super bad when you start up the game, it would not be playable like this. I spent time searching for a fix, but none worked. I was just about to return the game when I gave it a last chance and started a real level, the issue disappears. In the forum, one can see that this bug has been there for months. The game studio seems to be indifferent, thus I expect this to be a low-quality game.

I wish VR games would be more polished, however VR immersion makes up for a lot and I actually got quite a lot of enjoyable playtime out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999675395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1639759724}
review:
Seemingly a quite simple VR-ification of a game, but I quite enjoy running around looking at the wondrous environments and feeling immersed in the riddles. Thumbs up!
(Played on Oculus Quest via Virtual Desktop)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970560479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1533, 'last_played': 1600608191}
review:
Talos Principle is an incredible puzzle game.

The VR port is breathtakingly beautiful, so much that it's fun to just wander around and enjoy the environment.

Unfortunately the VR controls are quite frustrating. Some puzzles require precise placement of objects (or of yourself!), which is difficult to do with teleport, often with a high cost of needing to restart / redo large chunks of a puzzle because the teleport didn't land in the right place. "Grab" for grab object and "tight grab" for teleport is insane: here comes a bomb, better not drop this thing I'm holding, oh wait I accidentally jumped directly into the bomb. Hmm. Grab really needs to be an on/off button anyway, not a touch sensor. It's too easy to drop something accidentally, or NOT drop something when trying to place it exactly. I toyed with all available controls options and couldn't find settings that felt easy to use.

Overall the [i]environment[i] works incredibly well in VR, but the controls do not. I'd rather play the non-vr version using mouse/keyboard and Vorpx for VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325336843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1596730096}
review:
Считаю, что легендарные игры, которые были созданы без задумки ВР, лучше оставить таковыми. Волну хайпа лучше не ловить - накроет.
Но адаптация The Talos Principle на фоне остальных выглядит весьма неплохо: мир выглядит реалистично, топорности текстур нет, заветы физики - присутствуют. По стабильности на среднем уровне - не совсем плохо и не идеал.
Мир и атмосфера перенесены полностью - так же увлекает и захватывает, можно полностью погрузиться и почувствовать себя на месте главного героя.
Но все же, если выбирать между ВР и не ВР в The Talos Principle, я выберу последнее.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006914667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1597660962}
review:
At first I bought this for my girlfriend on her account then I almost had the game beat,  I will have to start over on my account.  This game is a lot of fun another reason bought it for VR. 
There are many levels, and this is not just a puzzle game there is also a somewhat of a story to play in between the levels.
If you like puzzles this is a must VR makes it feel like your more there,  I have had friends come over and play it in VR and they love it. 
I would rate this 4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197973505525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1681092644}
review: Interesting complicated puzzle based game with an interesting dark story interwoven into it. The VR version is amazing, the visuals were beautiful, although it is a must to turn on the smooth movement setting which could cause some nausea but is required for some puzzles. The story blew me away and made me really think what it is to be human while enjoying the interplay of evolution, religion, and technology. This game is underappreciated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043841072', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 3127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2357, 'last_played': 1668537428}
review:
Gra w dużym skrócie opowiada historię pewnego programu w ciele robota, który budzi się wewnątrz ogrodu. Po przebudzeniu tajemniczy głos dobiegający ze wszystkich stron świata wyjawia nam swoje imię i nazywa swoim dzieckiem. Przemierzając ogród rozwiązujemy zagadki w celu zebrania tzw. sigili, które wyglądają po prostu jak zwykłe klocki z klasycznego "Tetrisa". Po zebraniu odpowiedniej ilości, możemy przy ich pomocy odblokować bramy prowadzące w różne inne zakątki świata, jednak warunek jest jeden - nie wolno nam wejść do wieży znajdującej się pomiędzy ogrodami. W trakcie podróży napotykamy na tajemnicze terminale, pliki oraz dziwne wiadomości które wprowadzają gracza w konsternację.

The Talos Principle VR to klasyczna wersja Talosa przeportowana na wirtualną rzeczywistość. Mam obie wersje i pomimo tego, że są fabularnie i zagadkowo takie same to tak naprawdę robiąc przejście z kompa na VR'a trzeba się tej gry uczyć od samego początku. Nie chodzi tutaj o inny typ sterowania - nie da się tego w pełni wyjaśnić słowami - co innego jest patrzeć na monitor i podziwiać grafikę lub detale, a zupełnie inne jest doświadczenie kiedy cały umysł przenosi się do tego świata gry. Właśnie ta imersja VR'a sprawia, że pomiędzy tymi grami jest wielka przepaść pod względem emocji jakich doświadcza gracz. 

Interakcja z przedmiotami jest podobnie jak w klasycznej wersji ograniczona wyłącznie do przedmiotów z których musimy skorzystać by popchnąć fabułę do przodu. Standardowo, mamy 3 opcje poruszania się i tryb komfort dla osób wrażliwych - osobiście polecam chociaż spróbować to wyłączyć bo świetne uczucie jest kiedy wskakuje się na trampolinę lub wentylator. 

Nie brakuje tutaj również - a jakże - bugów. Póki co udało mi się znaleźć dziwnego buga, który występuje w momencie próby wskakiwania na obiekty (w grze, nie w realu). Kiedy odpowiednio wyceluje się kontrolerem i będzie skakać przy murku to w pewnym momencie zostaniemy.........ciężko to nazwać "wystrzeleniem".................. po prostu wyje**** z prędkością 2,5 macha w powietrze, gdzie możemy na 2 sekundy zobaczyć całą mapę z góry, po czym uderzamy głową w "sufit" tego świata i spadamy pionowo jak po wielkiej linijce dokładnie w ten sam punkt z którego wystartowaliśmy. Przy kilku próbach można przebić się przez ten "sufit" nad którym prawo grawitacji już nie obowiązuje co jest jednoznaczne z brakiem możliwości powrotu na mapę, a każdy skok powoduje unoszenie nas coraz wyżej i wyżej aż w końcu (nie, nie spotkamy Elohima) lądujemy w limbo. Ot taki sobie bug.

Innym bugiem jaki znalazłem to brak możliwości zdobycia jednej z gwiazdek, ponieważ nie ma FIZYCZNEJ możliwości aby po zrobieniu małej wieżyczki z kostek która unosi się na głowie miny, wskoczyć na te kostki. W klasycznej wersji nie ma tego problemu, ale na VR'ze spędzając 30 minut na tym stosując wszelkie możliwe sposoby łącznie z podchodzeniem w pokoju, gra nie pozwala zrobić markera do skoku na tę wieżę, tak jakby była za daleko. Brakuje dosłownie pół metra, aby wskoczyć ale mina już bliżej nie podchodzi.

Podsumowując, gra to klasyczny Talos jednak w wersji VR doznamy dużo większych emocji poprzez przeniesienie się do świata Talosa. Dopiero tutaj można zobaczyć jak ogromny jest ten świat i jak ogromne są obiekty które zwiedzaliśmy w klasyku (o ile oczywiście miał ktoś przyjemność zagrać).

Pozdrawiam i polecam :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198872725240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2659, 'last_played': 1700210485}
review:
吐血推荐的烧脑解密佳作！
谜题由易到难，设计独具匠心。有趣的是答案并不是唯一的，  既可以按部就班的过关，也有跳墙翻山的捷径。更有超级多的彩蛋，都非常吸引人。
难得的纯解密游戏，既不用战斗，也没有恐怖血腥的画面，景色秀美壮阔，用VR玩非常震撼。
而且用vr还免去了跑啊跳啊之类对手残党不友好的麻烦。
当然也有缺憾，首先是翻译实在让人无语，我觉得根本就是机翻的吧，本来很多文本说的就都是哲学、宗教之类抽象的东西，翻译过来更是词不达意，前言不搭后语，到后来看我干脆就不看了。
还有就是不知是不是移植的问题，有的彩蛋VR版收集不到，非常可惜。
而且那些彩蛋大部分都非常隐秘，如果是PC版还有可能乱走触发，只玩VR的话，我觉得不看攻略好多都发现不了>_<
总体来说还是很棒，超级推荐，尤其喜欢解密的小伙伴，没有VR，玩PC版的也一样有趣。
正价入手不亏，打折入手血赚，快来一起烧脑吧~~~

author: {'steamid': '76561198056444658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1476, 'last_played': 1596490643}
review:
Jedna z najlepszych gier w jakie grałem. Bardzo rozbudowana i ciekawa, zagadki także są mocnym punktem rozgrywki, w większości niepowtarzalne ale skonstruowane tak aby były rozwiązywalne samodzielnie. Wersja VR poza kilkoma błędami związanymi z wysokością bohatera i możliwością sięgnięcia po niektóre elementy (ograniczenie najpewniej wprowadzone aby nie dało się "oszukać" zagadek) jest dobrze przygotowana i można w nią przyjemnie grać. Grafika przyjemna, rozgrywka płynna.

Najmocniejszą stroną gry jest jednak historia. Bardzo ciekawy pomysł, choć wymaga nieco czytania aby w pełni się w nią wciągnąć. 

Bardzo polecam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078501560', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1581, 'last_played': 1596027036}
review: philospohy rocks

author: {'steamid': '76561197971880490', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1871, 'last_played': 1641267837}
review: This is now my favorite VR game. It's like portal but WAY better and much more fun. I'm sad I finished it. I looked forward to coming home from work and knocking out a few puzzles

author: {'steamid': '76561198264702671', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1649859909}
review:
This game is SERIOUSLY UNDERRATED.

Pros:
-Very good VR Port (Played on Oculus Rift)
-The Graphics are quite good and it makes for a zen like experience just taking in those beautiful Environments
-The puzzles are amazing and there are just soooo many of them
-The Game starts out pretty easy but gets decently hard towards the end
-Most of the story is optional, but i really recommend it, it is one of the deepest and most philosopical storys i have ever encountered in a game
-It doesn't get repetitive as new puzzle elements are unlocked at every stage

Cons:
-Multiple Savegames would have been nice
-The game lacks a clear indication when it saves your Progress (but tells you "Last Saved X Minutes ago" so i haven't lost any Progress to it)

Overall the game is amazing and completly UNDERRATED as in my Opinion it is as good if not even better than the Portal Series. All the Cons are fairly small and nothing that would be a deal breaker for me.
If you enjoyed Portal (who hasn't) you will probably like this game too.
I recommend you buying this right now, it is totally worth the price.
If you are unsure, the game is also often on sale for 5 bucks and thats a STEAL.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230227348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1707888018}
review: 10/10 better than any VR port Bethesda has ever touched

author: {'steamid': '76561198004655744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 2007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1677556082}
review:
Even after playing Half-Life: Alyx, this has been my most visually breathtaking VR experience. This was one of my favorite games of all time before the VR version, so to be there in VR is almost a dream come true. VR is the way I'd go for this game.

There are only a few drawbacks for this VR port, which are:

1. You can't carry two items at once, just like the flat version
2. Picking up the little tetris puzzle pieces used for opening doors or unlocking puzzle objects is more annoying than it needs to be
3. If your controllers go to sleep while the game is running and you wake them back up, the game menu might have trouble recognizing them
4. No ladder climbing animations

So no serious issues at all. In this game you explore various ancient ruins, including Egypt which is a place I've been to in person, and boy did Croteam do their research. It's like this game was made for VR, some of the visuals that were impressive in the flat game are just perfect in the VR version, most notably the tower.

The puzzle design of this game is some of my favorite of all time. They are as logical as it gets as every puzzle has a specific set of tools used to solve them, so you're working within confined rules making them the opposite of the abstract puzzles you see in other games like the Myst series. Every puzzle is a straightforward logical challenge so their complexity is very impressive and clever, most notably in Road to Gehenna which must have been designed by geniuses.

Everything including the puzzles, the computer terminals, the voice in the sky, it all ties back to one of the most thematically rich and emotionally powerful stories ever written for a game. The Talos Principle was always one of the least flawed masterpieces in gaming, and the VR version is the best way to experience it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186954897', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1595002954}
review: this game wasn't created with vr in mind

author: {'steamid': '76561198348245319', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1701534145}
review:
I have played the original PC version and absolutely loved it that I wanted to play it again. Being able to view the beautiful worlds in VR made it extremely worth it for me to buy again. 

I do have some concerns with controls, I couldn't figure out how to pick up connectors while preserving the connections I made. I couldn't figure out how to sprint, but I did find out that holding both grip buttons on the Oculus Touch controllers sped up in-game time. It's still a good port, but some changes could be made to the controls.

As for the ending, [spoiler] I didn't know how Croteam would achieve third person cutscenes in VR, but they managed to rework the scenes. I was a bit disappointed that they didn't do the scene with the zoom out revealing the outside and the EL Facility. I feel like they could've made this work by keeping the player stationary outside of the EL facility as the sun goes up to slowly reveal the EL facility and the world around it. It's understandable why they didn't add moving cameras, but I feel that they could've done better to maintain the original feel of the ending on the PC version. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198988481699', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1594239583}
review: Super logická hra, každopádně jsem nedohrál všechny levly, ale začíná to být čím dál tím větší výzva

review: Puzzle yer ass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198228963564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1593495331}
review: I like the game, but it controls poorly and is nausea-inducing. VR doesn't seem like a good fit for The Talos Principle. I recommend getting the normal game instead. This version also has many more glitches, including one that forced me to restart from the beginning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041327268', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1707, 'last_played': 1634495456}
review:
The game is not made for VR, but that is partially a good thing. Many games that are VR-exclusive are short and gimmicky; making up for their lack of content by "being VR". This game is not like that. It stands on its own as a game, with the VR being a bonus added on top. The game doesn't benefit greatly from being VR, but it doesn't hurt either unless you are prone to "VR sickness". If you like me are used to VR movement and have a VR headset, then I recommend getting it for VR, otherwise the pancake version might suit better. I also can't guarantee that it runs well on all headsets. Personally, I had no major technical problems on my Rift CV1.

The graphics quality is decent, but environments are severely lacking in variety. The puzzles are perfectly fine, nothing revolutionary, but for the most part really enjoyable. And there are a lot of them. The game started slow with many easy puzzles at first, but the difficulty increases at the later stages and some of the puzzles (in particular some of the optional star puzzles) are pretty challenging. (I have yet to complete everything though, and I have not even touched "Road to Gehenna" yet.)

The philosophical discussions are above expectations in my opinion. I was worried that the game would force you to pick from a narrow set of viewpoints, lacking any real depth, and although there is some of that (thee is only so much you can fit in a finitely sized set of dialogue trees) it still posed questions that made me think - sometimes several minutes - before deciding which of the four or so options best represented my viewpoint. You can't expect maximum expressiveness, but as long as you are willing to compromise a little bit it allows for a surprising amount of introspection. The point is not to defend your world view, but to explore the options. I found that I often looked forward to the next discussion with the terminal when solving puzzles.

There were some instances where I accidentally solved some puzzles in a unintended ways; it is a bit too easy to break some levels. But at least you can't get yourself stuck, because you always have a reset-ability at your disposal.

Some minor technical problems that I experienced were some weird graphical bug when using paint cans which forced me to either restart the game or play around in the settings menu until it resolved itself. I ended up mostly avoiding the paint cans in the end. Some graphical options had weird results, but fortunately everything I cared about worked, including the default settings. Seated mode doesn't exist, but that didn't prevent me from sitting down anyway. Sure, I got "shorter", but that doesn't affect gameplay much.

Overall, this is one of my favorite puzzle games and it is for sure the best VR puzzle game I've played (although I have played very few VR puzzle games).

author: {'steamid': '76561198151526078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 3346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2426, 'last_played': 1620547656}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011639428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1593811200}
review: I'm in love all over again

author: {'steamid': '76561198052353402', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 860, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1265, 'last_played': 1593025170}
review:
The Talos Principles is one of the best first person puzzle games out there and being able to play it in VR with no graphical compromises is amazing. 

Pros:
+ It's the biggest VR puzzler: the whole original Talos + Road to Gehenna. The only thing missing is conversion of flat-screen workshop items. VR version has Steam workshop support, but there is nothing there
+ A lot of graphical and comfort settings, decent optimization

Cons:
- Almost everyone played flat-screen version and this is not the kind of game that you would replay. Luckily several years have passed since my initial playthrough, so I forgot almost every puzzle)
- There are few minor visual bugs, especially in Gehenna

author: {'steamid': '76561198025599358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1594262205}

author: {'steamid': '76561198153120184', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1585006955}
review:
The Talos Principle is a good puzzle game, but I feel like it doesn't get much from being in VR.
It's also pretty sad that it is a standalone VR port, which means if you haven't bought it twice you can't switch between VR and non-VR,

author: {'steamid': '76561198067051062', 'num_games_owned': 1674, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1595039871}
review: While I'm not really sure if this game [i]needs[/i] to be VR, or how much it benefits from being in VR, there's definitely nothing [i]wrong[/i] with it.  It's a perfectly solid port.  If you liked the flat version, you'll like this version as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051285281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1697, 'last_played': 1592003342}
review: Wow, just wow. I got this game heavily discounted from the humble store and it is the best deal I've ever gotten. This game will make you question your own existence and contemplate life and death, along with providing excellently crafted puzzles and world building. Such a cool experience. The VR port is damn near perfect to boot. If your a fan of puzzles or just good storytelling, play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964660097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1495, 'last_played': 1638592272}
review:
The puzzles are excellent.  The story is OK.  The VR controls for the 2d jigsaw puzzles and elevator buttons needs a lot of work.

If the controls were fixed I would rate this higher, but as it is, I have to rate at 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003308946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1619437161}
review: would recommend this game to anyone looking for a challenge and who likes puzzles and philosophy. This game is obviously made with a lot of love. all of the levels are unique and very fun to play, but the best part is learning the story as it unfolds, conversations with the terminals are my favourite bit. you get a lot of game for your money and i would say its a good mix of logic and philosophy thought experiments with a good dose of sharp humour  havent finished it yet but looking forward to finishing it cant put it down

author: {'steamid': '76561198824276545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6379, 'last_played': 1619231458}

author: {'steamid': '76561198169094866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1680295313}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198055147883', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1683074730}
review:
I'm only 2 hours in, yet... wow. Yes, the game hasn't been made for VR and it shows, but the immersion is astonishing.
I found myself stopping with any progression to enjoy the beautiful scenery and listen to the game's calming soundtrack so often I bet it took like half my total playtime.

Pros:
[list]
[*]The game is absolutely beautiful. The visuals are a bit dated and there is some visible model pop-in, but it still looks great.
[*]Amazing soundtrack
[*]Unlike most VR games, it doesn't feel like a tech demo, but a truly complete experience.
[*]It's one of the only games out there that natively supports Linux, and I can't thank the devs enough for that.
[*]I don't know much about the story yet due to my short playtime, but it's promising. I will update this review after I finish it.
[/list]

As for the cons, there are quite a few that I cannot overlook:
[list]
[*]It doesn't make much sense to stand in the game, yet it doesn't have a seated mode. You technically can change the world scale to better fit seated gameplay, but it's not a good solution. The devs mentioned on the forums that the vr_fDesiredVRHeadHeight config option should solve it, but it doesn't do anything for me. [u]We really need a working height slider in the options![/u]
[*]Door animations are glitchy - sometimes when I insert a key into a door, the opening animation doesn't play and it appears as the door stays closed. You can still go through it, so it doesn't break the gameplay, but it's annoying
[*]Low performance on Linux - I blame that on the flawed SteamVR implementation, so I think Croteam can't really do anything about it. If you're playing on Linux, expect some minor reprojection issues when looking at some areas. Nothing really bad, but worth mentioning.
[*]If you played the flat version, I don't think it's worth paying the full price again for essentially the same thing, just way more immersive. Thankfully, I haven't played it before.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197988839615', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1600481994}
review: A solid puzzle game in VR that ramps up in difficulty but never feels tedious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972104605', 'num_games_owned': 797, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1575081093}
review: Even though you have two hands, you can only use one at a time. This game was ported to VR "just because". They sell the same game as a new title just because it's in VR, but in my opinion, it's not justified. If you're interested in The Talos Principle, at least go with the non-VR version, it'll be more comfortable at least, since it's pretty much the same experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044806653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1584906921}
review: The Talos Principle is a fantastic game, but the concept of VR is entirely wasted here. I was hoping that they at least made some levels to take advantage of VR, but it's literally just the same game, no changes except you can move the camera with your head and teleport around. It's cool if you want to admire the scenery as if it were real life, but other than that you're better off just playing the standard version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038704419', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1245, 'last_played': 1587791236}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065863581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1545249826}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078361652', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1587072217}
review:
10 minutes. it took me 10 minutes to see how lazy this vr port is.

you see, the talos principle is probably one of the best games ever made. on a flat screen, its presentation, gameplay and storyline are all phenomenal.

in vr, however, the experience falls apart before it even begins. the opening cutscene is simply not there, and i suspect other cutscenes (which are few and far between I must admit) may also be missing. this is important because the big reveal at the end of the game is a flat cutscene. the base game looks fantastic for its age, but the graphics don't survive in vr. things are pixelated and blurry, models are jagged, plants are flat and fake looking. you can put your face inside anything that's not out of bounds, including cubes, jammers etc, but if you do physically walk out of bounds instead of blocking your view or something, you're jarringly and awkwardly teleported backwards. everything you can pick up is weightless and feels unpleasant to handle, things sticking to your hand rather than behaving like real objects.

[spoiler]and you know, i get it. the whole point of the talos principle is that the world [i]is[/i] fake. but a big part of that is how convincingly real everything looks at the beginning, so i fail to see this as any sort of excuse or scapegoat to have such a shoddy and shockingly lazy vr port.[/spoiler] it's buggy too - if i squeeze both of my hands into fists, all audio stops until i release them again. this is probably the best example i could find out of all the various ways the game manages to find in order to break or otherwise shatter your immersion.

i paid £4.49 for this on sale, and i've already asked for my money back. i cannot believe that they charge £30 for this normally. this is the absolute worst way to play talos principle, and charging just about £10 short of the new half life for that experience is anything from scummy through to stupid. don't waste your time, money or effort.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048808881', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1587392750}
review:
Feels very beta like. As if they took a "flat" game and just added the VR option. Twice I had that my body and soul seperated, making me have an out of body experience(the 3d player model stood in place while I was able to walk around it).

Lot's of times I see things in the corners of my eyes, only to realise it is my body that somehow got seperated as well. I am a vivid member of an Indian tribe, but even in our trance we only should see our spirit animals, not ourselves!

ninja edit:  The game should keep your height in mind, I have to sqaut to reach every damn terminal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001125375', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1585913147}
review: I just couldn't get used to the VR locomotion - wish they would use directional teleporting like Robo Recall. I gave up after about an hour. In the current state, I would much prefer to play the 2D version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277559200', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2047, 'last_played': 1587834263}
review: This game is easily on top of my VR list and among the best games I've ever played. Just play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970549386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1586651733}
review:
I wanted to like this game, having only ever played it in VR - the VR port has performance issues. I had to play it on medium settings on a valve index with a 2080ti and an i9 9900k. Even so, it looked rough, and no amount of super sampling seemed to help.

What's more, the control scheme actively seems to fight the index controllers, constantly grabbing objects and obstacles without meaning to. Overall a frustrating experience, and probably a better game in 2d.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059069448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1605405942}
review:
This game is sheer brilliance. It feels like exploring a labyrinth that Carl Sagan might write about. The atmosphere and tone of this game inspires awe and wonder towards human evolution. To top it off it's always a joy to have a dialogue with the serpent in the terminals about philosophy. The environments are beautiful and are that much more stunning experiencing it in VR.

The puzzles themselves are rather clever. Each section builds on previous knowledge and overtime become quite difficult. I've been struggling a great deal on many of the red piece areas but personally I think that makes the game worthwhile.

As far as being a VR port is concerned, Croteam did an excellent job. There are plenty of settings you can adjust for locomotion, comfort, etc. Obviously it would be amazing if the objects had realtime physics but considering this game was built for a flatscreen monitor initially they really did a fine job making everything functional for VR.

All in all this game is a unique, almost meditative experience. Definitely worth checking out if you find yourself wanting to try something with a relaxing pace and that will at times make you reflect on the larger questions in life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198870635735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4302, 'last_played': 1612679963}
review:
Ah, one of my favorite games to play in VR. But be warned - this game will either make you hurl or you'll develop a VR gut of steel.
Loved the Europe-inspired ruins. Such a beautiful and peaceful game to play. Get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041301654', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1552356742}
review: Flawless port of the original Talos Principle however the issues that game had are only magnified in VR, overlong campaign filled redundant puzzles makes keeping attention in VR even harder than ususal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141245660', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1711, 'last_played': 1675719398}
review: Worth every penny of the flat game and the VR version. When I was playing the flat version I was quite younger and more stupid so the puzzles were beyond me but I've got more brains now and can manage most of the puzzles on my own, which is nice. But the VR version is so well done, even if I have to lean up a bit from my seat to read the terminals. It's a beautiful game and, as always, terribly interesting. Also, excellent optimization of movement throughout, which is critical to a VR experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117028237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1634419840}
review:
This may be one of my favorite VR titles so far. The graphics are not the best and you can often see that it wasn't originally made with VR in mind, but it does not really break the immersion. Outside of playing the game itself, some of the worlds are also nice for short, relaxing getaways when, say, you are stuck at home for a long time during a pandemic. :))

The game mechanics are perfectly suited for VR. I can't really imagine going back to mouse + keyboard with this one. Compared to other VR games, this port also naturally comes with a lot of content, which is something that many pre-2020 VR games made from scratch were missing.

Few hours in, the puzzles are still somewhat easy, but I expect them to get harder in time. The story and / or lore also seems interesting so far, and I love the short philosofical texts and stories along the way. Definitely recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046077368', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1577187040}
