author: {'steamid': '76561198222423736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1667964120}
review: It actually stumped me every now and then. Good puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991202316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1515696068}
review:
The puzzles in this are great! The story was intriguing, although unoriginal. This was a game that was always in the back-burner to pick up. Once it was on VR I decided that it was one of the first I wanted to get. Booting it up I found the creators put a lot of time an energy into making it tolerable to motion sickness. This probably should have been a warning sign.

I'm actually pretty good with VR not getting motion sick at all. I've spent hours in other VR Games. However... I don't know what it is about the graphics but I found it unplayable. At most I could spend 15 minutes before needing to stop and catch a breather. I went with the clunky but less sick inducing motion and setup. I've hosted game nights with VR and every player who played this couldn't last as long as I did. I just can't recommend this at risk of actual sickness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060528572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1585397481}
review:
I really liked the difficulty of the puzzles and even though there are so many puzzles you almost have to use a different approach for each puzzle. It does not get repetitive at all. The story was intriguing . The narrator actually gave me goosebumps here and there.
On the other hand, I have played it on Oculus Rift. Grabbing and handling items on VR was a nightmare throughout the game. At some point, I had to play with game settings ,switch from teleport to locomotion, just to pass one of the levels. I was on a mine travelling and I had to grab a box which was not possible with the teleport set up for some reason. In addition, I kept losing the sound while I was holding items as well.

Great game but was not very pleasant to play it on Oculus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077173611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 2081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1532, 'last_played': 1584317176}
review:
After some slightly uninspired opening hours, this turned out to be pretty ace :)

[h1]To VR Or Not To VR?:[/h1]

VR elevates a bunch of the existing qualities here. The hand-held devices, physics interactions, and 'jungle gym' puzzle solving put you right in the centre of the action. It makes for a fun mix of cerebral tinkering followed by active enacting. (And occasionally combines the two. There's something to be said for soaring 20ft up on a column of air to get a bird's eye view of the puzzle ;))

The Cryengine locations form a lovely expansive backdrop (even if the 'photo realistic' style can't always survive you nosing right up to its more budget bump-maps). And the whole 'ghost in the machine' / 'simulated world' story gains some extra vibe when you're actually injected into those digital spaces ;)


[h1]It's A Laser Trap:[/h1]

The five core tools that you unlock aren't the only way they keep things fresh, with further twists arriving downstream. There are a few moments were they over-rely on the core techniques though. (Oh, more laser-round-an-impossible-corner conundrums?). But just as frequently they'll surprise you by making a novel physical interaction the crux of the next map, or add a new use for an environmental hazard instead.

As a puzzle game, the key thing for me was: I frequently stood in the middle of these breezy virtual spaces, hands on hips, and said: 'That's impossible'. And then worked it out anyway. Sometimes multiple times in one map . They've got the 'make you feel smart' thing pretty nailed down, with only perhaps one or two maps that bordered on feeling unfair / frustrating.


[h1]If A Story Is Trapped In A Box, Is It Really There?[/h1]

The primarily text-based story is almost entirely optional, but I found myself welcoming the dips into the computer terminals in every realm. It does help if you like ancient philosophy, arguing theology, AI ethics, and pondering the nature of 'self' though 

Not that their archive of mythical excerpts and a 'chose from these answers' interface can really encompass this spread of dialectic disagreements and contemporary mysteries. But they have a damn good go 


---

[h1]Too Long Didn't Read Your Metaphysical Treatise:[/h1]

[b]Positives:[/b]
[list][*]Tons of content, scaling over time, with various flavours of twists to the trickiness.
[*]A playful nested story that taps into themes of consciousness, free will, ethics and theology. And then occasionally sticks its tongue out at you 
[*]Lovely settings and audio work.[/list]

[b]Negatives:[/b]
[list][*]Slow, slightly insipid, start.
[*]A couple of unintuitive story twists can leave you locked out of further progression, having to restart from a few saves back. It's clunky. (Hint: If you 'exit' from a story terminal you often can't turn it back on...)[/list]

[b]Motion Comfort:[/b]
[list][*]Despite the consummate control options, you may need your VR legs to deal with some of the shunts and jumps involved when boxes misplace or airstreams propel you sideways through the air...[/list]

[h1]Postscript:[/h1]

And I'm still going with the free DLC content, which has kept the difficulty fiendishly ramped up, and given the story some new fun twists 

---

4+ [nausea possible]

author: {'steamid': '76561197980722015', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1582215710}
review: It finally works flawlessly with the index controllers and the performance is greatly improved as well. I've already played this game to death in 2D and VR is neat but it doesn't add much to the gameplay. It's a shame no one uses the Cryengine for VR games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969284508', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1586577926}
review: I fully completed Talos Principle on flatscreen and I absolutely love it, it's a masterpiece. I got the VR version in order to play the Road to Gehenna DLC. Looking good so far!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079074554', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1586749819}
review:
Id say this is one of the best VR games there is, the port works great. The price is a bit steep if you own the flat version though, but well worth it anyway. Game looks amazing in VR, you really get a sense for how big everything is. And the controls are good. Something i miss is locking your height so you dont feel like a dwarf when you play seated, since it is a quite long game to be standing up.

Also, you can use the save file from the flat version of the game which is a huge plus

author: {'steamid': '76561198113653131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1585265000}
review: Good little puzzle game, the computer religious texts were a little unexpected, the game seems to have some sort of religious theme  running through it everything from Hebrew to Aztec it would appear. Bur that does not detract from the game play which is essentially solving puzzles and collecting sidguels which are coloured shapes you use to open gateways to  other places and more puzzles and more siduels. The locations are impressive and some of the puzzles are tricky to solve not as straight forward as they first appear but do able and fun. Spent 4 hours on it so far and reckon there is a fair way to go before what ever the point is is made clear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020416096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1470, 'last_played': 1583079108}
review: Excellent level design, great brain teaser puzzles - some of which require out of the box thinking. The story is very philosophical, and the VR aspect of the game adds a lot to the experience. Very well made VR port and it is great to play on the Valve Index. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050672642', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 5102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1653, 'last_played': 1706476443}
review:
[b]Index Controller mapping solution at the end![/b]
This is the single greatest VR title I have played so far. The story is amazing (DON'T skip the terminals!), the VR port is simply leagues above anything else out there and the menu options make sure anyone is able to set it exactly as they want to.
I spent maybe 30 hours in the game (finished all endings yesterday, now I'm going for the DLC).
When I got to the pets.html article it really got to me... I guess I am [spoiler]comfortable with all humanity going extinct but get very emotional over a few hungry cats[/spoiler] :D

The only problem is Index Controller mapping, which by default jumps when you grip harder. So you pick up an object and as you grip harder, you jump. Fortunatelly, this can be reconfigured in SteamVR settings in Controller/Custom mapping. I just removed that jump action from the Grip event and saved as my own mapping. The game will reset to the original mapping each time you start it, but you can just switch to your custom (by then saved) mapping and game on. It takes 30 seconds. It's definitely annoying and I guess kinda big oversight (or maybe dev abandonment), but I am willing to put up with it as the game is SO FREAKING GOOD!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018060714', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1184, 'last_played': 1581575194}
review: A must have if you enjoy puzzle games. Runs flawlessly on the Rift CV1, controls work great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968830351', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 2354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1651, 'last_played': 1582688331}
review: Most fun I have had in VR to date. If you enjoyed portal, this is the best VR equivalent. Only one puzzle I would say was one unfair. The other 3 I needed google with...well....those are on me. Story was shockingly great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161202424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1577484106}
review: Was excited to play this game, love the studio's last releases. Honestly disappointed! :(  Looks very nice and the controls work well, just found the puzzles a bit boring. 3 stars at best....Sorry Croteam, love ya!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972140284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 6417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2215, 'last_played': 1687027543}
review:
[h1]"Buy me." (Experienced with the Valve Index HMD & Controllers[/h1]

The VR version of this game, as usual, adds a great deal of enjoyment to the game (the usual headtracking + stereoscopy boost, with some natural grab/finger-tracking added to the control scheme).

[i]I originally played the non-VR version minus extended content.[/i]

Both versions are identical aside from some input options and a single cutscene/angle which was, for whatever reason, MIA during my playthrough (non-issue, really).

The Index version includes finger-tracking which provides effortless input in a few cases, but somewhat problematic in some of the extended content which had not yet been fully optimized for it. Either way, as is usually the case, I can't see anything being able to beat the experience of the Index (especially if the game also has lifelike audio. . . unfortunately, this game does not, but the Index's off-ears are always great, regardless).

If you haven't played Talos, the game really [i]is[/i] a [i]must[/i] buy. The puzzles are fun. . .but the story is fantastic -- even if it finds itself "preaching to the converted". . .or perhaps, especially in this case; it's very nice to see a game that's-, oddly enough, based firmly in reality. . . in a way (it's as real, and meaningful as things get, story wise...a real breath of fresh air in this medium).

Parting note: I don't play with the English voice-over (I find it. . .distracting, maybe even. . .unfitting). I have enjoyed the game most in a spoken language I'm familiar with, but not at all fluent in -- with subtitles enabled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198960691005', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2176, 'last_played': 1587681241}
review: I wish this game was more popular. The seemingly infinite number of puzzles is shocking! So many views and references with just the right amount of story. I love it! Thx Croteam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198831913636', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1698948443}
review:
I got this game for 7$ when it was on sale and for that price it is a very good value game.
The story is interesting, and the graphics are good enough.
Overall this is a fantastic game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198382306349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1633, 'last_played': 1700078435}
review: Игра, которая заняла меня на довольно долгое время. Мир проработан отлично, просто ходишь и любуешься. Головоломки иногда совсем просты, иногда сложные, лишь пара в конце заставила меня действительно попотеть. А еще, одна из немногих VR-игр, из-за которой меня периодически укачивало. В такие моменты хотелось бы сыграть через монитор, но не тут-то было, оказывается The Talos Principle VR и The Talos Principle это разные игры, купив одну - не значит что получил вторую. Не совсем ясна такая логика. Но в любом случае, игра стоит того, чтоб в нее сыграть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000419251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1585687527}
review: Просто топ. Как я прошел мимо этой игры непонятно. Это дикая смесь философии, научпопа и постапокаллипсиса с головоломками уровня портал. Красивая картинка, крутые головоломки. Если нет VR, берите 2d, разница только в картинке.

author: {'steamid': '76561198872292085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3227, 'last_played': 1710326381}
review: Bei "The Talos Principle VR" handelt es sich um ein wunderschönes Rätsel-Spiel, das mit vielen philosophischen Elementen in unterschiedlichsten Erscheinungsformen bereichert ist. Es ist fast wie Urlaub, wenn man abends nach Feierabend noch "mal eben" zwei, drei Stunden sich in die Talos-Welt begibt und Rätsel löst oder auch mal einfach nur durch die sehr schön gestaltete Landschaft wandert und diese auf sich wirken lässt. Gewundert habe ich mich, dass das Spiel ursprünglich nur für Bildschirm entwickelt worden ist und erst später nach VR portiert wurde. Ich kann mir kaum vorstellen, wie man "The Talos Principle" nicht als VR-Spiel spielen kann. Es lebt ja geradezu davon, sich mitten in der Welt zu befinden und auch so die Rätsel zu lösen oder die Welten zu erleben und zu genießen. Das Spiel habe ich während einer Aktion für unter sechs Euro erhalten, aber es ist definitiv aus meiner Sicht auch den realen Kaufpreis wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075799424', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1603802332}
review:
The sense of presence is acute in this game. Playing through the gloriously sunny opening level in the depth of a Scottish winter is a powerful reminder of how immersive VR can be. 

Would visit again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076790219', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1580074537}
review:
Played the flat screen version, loved it. Bought the VR version as soon as I got my Rift S.  
The VR version is literally the exact same game BUT IN VR!  
Totally worth it even if you played the flat screen. Only gripe is the performance isn't the best. After playing around with settings I found that ultra everything except for shadow trilinear filtering gives me a solid 40 fps with perfect frame time. Makes the game feel smooth and I don't notice that it's 40 fps. The game says 40 FPS at least...  
I can definitely notice when a game drops from 75 fps to 60 so it's strange I dont notice the 40 fps

author: {'steamid': '76561197970983304', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 6087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6086, 'last_played': 1580594671}
review: One of the best puzzle games I've ever played and with a good story to boot. It was a fantastic experience in VR, this includes the expansion pack Road to Gehenna. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198815244160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 6048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1169, 'last_played': 1611545905}
review:
Perfekní hra, krásná grafika včetně prostředí VR .  Hodně logická a to se mi moc na této hře líbí.  Vřele doporučuji .
Perfect game, beautiful graphics including VR environment. A lot of logic and that much like this game. I warmly recommend .

author: {'steamid': '76561198100235888', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1579392880}
review: was a great game. sadly i got back bars on the top and bottom of each eye in this one. restricted fov from those black bars made me regret getting this

author: {'steamid': '76561198041149620', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2285, 'last_played': 1581371062}
review: This game is incredible. Challenging puzzles, beautifully crafted worlds, and an absolutely fantastic soundtrack. I had this game in my library for an entire year before finally playing it, and I was absolutely hooked. Played for almost 40 hours in the span of about 2 weeks to completely finish the game, and I haven't even played the DLC yet! I would absolutely have paid full price for this, but when it's on sale it's a no-brainer. For anyone wanting a portal-esque VR experience, this is it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198796205657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 21635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 107, 'playtime_at_review': 6261, 'last_played': 1711905996}
review: Just enough difficulty for me to play and enjoy, but I seriously don't think I will ever complete the game on my own.  Still a lot of fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994563527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1551, 'last_played': 1578830008}

Slandaro

author: {'steamid': '76561198141273810', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1616954935}
review:
this is bad VR adaptation of very intresting game 

After some time there is grafic bug which changes colors. I discovered at steam forums that it occurs since long time.
There is walkaround to fix this but it make even more bugs.

Game is poorly adjusted for [b]Valve Index[/b] any button triggers teleportation it is flustrating to die because you accidentally teleport in death zone insted of rotate. There is no option to change key mapping

author: {'steamid': '76561198263463672', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1584812871}
review: One of my favorite VR experiences. The puzzles of very fun and satisfying, the world is beautiful and has a lot of graphical settings allowing lower end as well as higher end PC's to run it, the world seems pretty expansive and is worth a try on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198977566412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1151, 'last_played': 1600625437}
review:
There is a lot to do, but in quite repeating fashion.  There is nice and exiting story, but it involves quite much low resolution reading in VR. Controller setting do need some work and reasonable controls do cause quite high level of motion sickness ( I don not feel any sickness in most games ).

I can imagine far better VR games, but only Beat Saber is better that this one in my library .

Bye if you like puzzle games and do not have any motion sickness in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062545351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1578500176}
review:
6/10. The game became unplayable.

Pro:
- Many kinds of puzzle
- Compared with others puzzle games, it is a long game (7h, I am in the half, without taking help from internet)
- Good history.
- A lot of creativity to make a game so fun and envolving.

Cons:
- It has a teleport gameplay, sometimes I pressed the wrong button and died, back to the start for no reason
-The "recorder"made this thing unplayable. Need a "stop" buttom, at least.
- It uses engine and effects from Serious Sam. It is not exactly a bad thing, only if you play it before playing The Talos Principle. I was startled, thinking when it would appear some scary monster while I am without weapons.

No monster in the game, of course.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048615656', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1578268936}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053912592', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1578081500}
review: Très bon jeu avec de magnifiques paysages. J'ai déjà joué à la version normale du jeu et la je recommence avec la version VR. Je recommande ce jeu aux fans d'énigmes et de jeux comme Portal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111577313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1550206633}
review: Great VR puzzle game with well-done VR set-up. Graphics are excellent for the setting and give the realistic feel. Fairly simple though and while I enjoyed playing it, I got a little bored after completing several similar puzzles. Did not yet finish the game but do plan to go back to it as I really enjoyed the environment. Maybe the puzzles change if I progress further.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041737972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1581943031}
review: One of the best puzzle games for VR, I'm Serious. First thing I said to myself after picking up the axe: "Look ma, I'm a lumberjack!"

author: {'steamid': '76561197969827674', 'num_games_owned': 639, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1584759156}
review:
I hate to do this because this is a good port and a great game but the current version's Index controller support is broken and the devs appear to have abandoned the game.

They were active on the forums but are not responding now and don't appear interested in fixing the problem.

The issue is that pressing the grips causes the player to jump. This means you go around jumping constantly when you just want to perform simple actions even though jump is already assigned to the A button. You also cannot unmap the touch bad from locomotion meaning you are constantly moving around by accident when you don't want to.

There are also issues with jumping on some Oculus controllers.

Do not buy this game until the devs address these issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064743380', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1583297686}
review:
►THIS = (Portal's mind twisting puzzles) + (beautiful ancient ruins) in VR
►Voted in 'Top VR Hidden Gems you didn't know about' @ JoinUsInVR Group (Key Giveaways) 

An amazing game.  I played it in 2D and just started the 3D in VR.  This feels like it was made for VR !

-----------DETAILED REVIEW-----------
[quote]
BY: Ghanth (JoinUsInVR member)
READ FULL:  https://steamcommunity.com/id/Ghanth/recommended/552440/

Playing The Talos Principle in VR is like hacking your own consciousness. Yes, you have a brain. And you also have two hands that let you interact with this strange anachronic world of ancient ruins and technology. And you will learn it has great plans for you.

You'll go for an introspective journey that'll help you unfold your Metaphysical intelligence. The puzzles are incredibly clever and often requires you to think out of the box you were comfortable within.

You could also find yourself have a stop just to contemplate the shadows of the upper clouds sliding on those beautiful sceneries or be impressed by the gigantic size of this tower... Magical moments of VR.

The lifetime of the game is pretty larger than what we were used to up to now in VR and the VR version also includes Road to Gahenna DLC wich is awesome too.

Plus Croteam refused to fall into the wall garden strategy trap that FB/Oculus was offering them. So it's still available here for every VR player today. We, as users, could reward this attitude if we care about standing for freedom of choice in this merciless world.

That's a fair price in regards to what a good VR portage it is, and VR definitely unleash the beauty of this existential work of art. [/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198919913516', 'num_games_owned': 1654, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1577983260}
review:
Н е в е р о я т н о  красивая игра. Графика радует глаз, музыка радует слух, а качество перевода (и озвучки, и титров) вызывает только гордость за отечественных локализаторов. Попадая внутрь игры, можно легко забыть о реальном мире, настолько сильно передается атмосфера. Это всё уже не единожды было воспето. От себя хочется отметить следующее: Дойдя до края игрового пространства, ты не чувствуешь, что банально упёрся в край, за которым осталось на пару шагов текстур, а то, что в тот обширный открытый мир, из которого веет ветерком, тебе запрещено высшим разумом. Нельзя просунуть голову сквозь текстуру, чтобы подсмотреть и сжульничать. Эффекты глюков картинки усиливают эффект реальности окружающей тебя нереальности. И уже за одно это можно купить принцип Талоса в свою коллекцию.

  Что касается игрового процесса, то через несколько часов рутинной расстановки предметов (их в арсенале всего несколько), я понял, что так же красиво, как у Бенуа Сокаля вовсе не значит, что это и так же увлекательно. А когда прошёл первый мир, стало откровенно скучно. Вся игра, это решение «шахматных задачек» двух типов – за сигил в отдельно взятой комнате и за звезду, которая может быть и вне комнаты. С ростом сложности на «шахматные доски» подбрасываются новые фигурки, которые открываются за добытые сигилы. Что касается сигилов, добыть их вполне реально и собственным умом, со звездами же задачи на голову сложнее. Здесь мыслить предстоит нестандартно, не забывать, что фигурки запрещено выносить только через парадный вход и что прятаться они могут вне комнат, и даже быть готовым искать чёрную кошку в тёмной комнате. А если вы не входите в 5% особо одарённых логиков, то пару-тройку раз вам всё же придется признать свою несостоятельность при обращении к прохождению. Может быть, это дань уважения Стратону и его «принципу Талоса»? Если «даже самый верный философ не сможет жить без своей крови», то почему самый упорный игрок должен обходиться без солюшена? Лично я окончательно развёл руками после того, как пять раз ставил куб на курсирующего дроида, и пять раз он с него сваливался. А дело было в том, что куб нужно было ставить на дроида немного дальше по его курсу. По мне это абсурд, обманом разрушивший ход моих умозаключений и указавший мне на выход из апартаментов сильнейших логиков.

  И в заключении моё резюме – красота спасёт любой мир. Даже виртуальный. Пусть игра однообразна и сложна, но зато как красива. Я голосую «за».

author: {'steamid': '76561198038249667', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1575683956}
review:
The VR port of the game is just not that good. Simple problems like standing on a stair-step making the camera move up and down, which is headache inducing in VR, add up really fast resulting in a experience that is just not enjoyable. The game also uses too much text written in small letters to convey a story. It's already bad on the Index, I can't imagine how hard it is to read on a Vive or Oculus.

I think you are better off getting the non-vr version. The puzzles seemed interesting enough, and the story intriguing. Only the VR implementation was lacking.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987992997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1576536831}
review: Serious Sam w wersji logiczno-filozoficznej.  W pięknej oprawie graficznej, klimatycznej muzyce. W pełni spolszczony -  to jest ogromny plus jeśli chcemy w pełni poczuć klimat. Warto, ale dobrze kupić ze zniżką.

author: {'steamid': '76561198980172625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1575387095}
review:
VRって言うとドンパチ、リズム、又はエロス。 
と言うイメージが強かったのですが、こいつぁめっけもんだな。 
 
元のゲームは全く知らず、VR版が初体験。 
２０ステージ程クリアした感触を...
一言にするなら、立体アクションパズル。 
パズルと言っても、一定の動きを繰り返す「自爆する球体型メカ」や「設置型のガトリング砲」を 、「動きを止めるビーム発射タレット」を動かしてゴールまでの道を切り開く、言葉にすると物騒だが、荘厳な雰囲気やBGM、謎の多いSFの様なファンタジーの様な神秘的な世界観が彩る、（ガトリングの見た目以外は）血生臭さの欠片もない微アクション含有のパズルゲーム。 
 
激しい動きは無いが、ステージ間の移動が結構ある。周囲の確認に首を振る。パズルを解くのに頭を使う。何か良く解らん哲学的な文章や世界観で更に頭を使う。等で長時間プレイすると酔い易い人はキツイかも。１プレイ１時間程度で気長に攻略を推奨。 
 
一つのステージが早ければ１分、遅くても１０分もあれば解ける程良い難易度。どうしても無理なら後回しにしても問題無し。グラフィックも綺麗だし、日本語字幕だけでなく日本語音声が入ってるのもグ―。ドンパチ飽きた、リズムは疲れた、腰が...なんて人にはオススメ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198086094471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1572161211}
review:
Do NOT buy this if you own an Oculus Rift S!

I didn't check the tags to see that this specifically the S is unsupported; the image as you move around only changes in one eye leaving you nauseated and unplayable.

Developer support only checks their email every 2 weeks, and says they're working on Oculus Rift S support. This headset release 9 months ago! 

Don't make my mistake, this game sat in my library before I tried to play it so I'm inelligible for a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147665201', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1600957203}

author: {'steamid': '76561198265048136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1349, 'last_played': 1584401963}
review:
Having just completed The Talos Principle I feel I have experienced enough to review the game. 

My first impression was it looks stunning. I have a fairly high end setup and ran everything in ultra which may have helped. The first world is reasonably large and the game takes you through the first easy tutorial levels without it feeling too forced. The puzzle pieces themselves are not new lazers, blocks & switches and there are a few baddies orbs and guns. I didn't have any trouble getting into the game and getting solving. I think I cleared 2/3 of the first world in about 3 hours, including some exploring of the wider areas.

Then things start to get tricky. There are a few more tools to play with and some far more complex puzzles. One mistake I made was to stop for a few weeks then went back to it. I'd forgotten a few key tricks and that made working out some of the later puzzles much harder than they needed to be. Though tricky they rarely felt impossible and I only came close to reaching for a walk through twice. I'm not sure if it's a spoiler but every puzzle is contained in its box, getting stars on the other hand often requires thinking outside the box.

As you get used to the style of puzzles the story and philosophies discussed in Talos do become more engaging. I liked listening to what she had to say and reading the material was an interesting break that adds to the feeling of progression more than just "here comes another puzzle". Talking to the serpent did bug me occasionally because sometimes you're limited to a small number of unhelpful responses, but its only for a bit and it gets better. And personally I'm not overly keen on the getting killed by baddies in puzzle games. Really a baddie is not much different to a door (i.e. you can't pass till you get the key) but they reset all the solution you had so far. So you have to redo the part of the solution you already puzzled out. Not so bad at the start but when it's the last thing and you get caught on a wall or rotate accidentally it feels like you've been cheated.

Given the subject matter it shouldn't be surprising but I found it made me feel quite lonely on occasion!

There were only a few  puzzles where I felt the answer relied too heavily on precise placements or dodgy physics (maybe there was a better answer) and I could forgive it because they were rare and the sense of achievement from completing a puzzle that has had you stumped is always good.

In short it's a good puzzle game with an engaging story and well worth the asking price.

Now to get stuck into Road to Genhennena... Genheyar... Guinea pig... the other set of puzzles that come with The Talos Principle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978863243', 'num_games_owned': 944, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1636701077}
review:
Sintiéndolo mucho, le tengo que dar una manita para abajo. El juego en sí es muy bueno, y jugarlo en VR con la sensación de estar en esos bucólicos escenarios está genial. Pero en la ficha del juego se indica claramente que se puede jugar sentado, y eso es mentira, al menos si juegas con un Rift S. Y es que si juegas sentado con este visor, tu vista estará muy cerca del suelo, y eso además de molesto, te hace imposible interactuar con cosas como los monitores o algunos puzzles. Es un juego de muchas horas, y quiero jugarlo sentado, además de que me gusta jugar con desplazamiento libre y me marea un poco de pie, no así sentado. En las opciones del juego no hay posibilidad de indicarle al juego una altura o si estás jugando sentado, solo una opción de escala del mundo que lo que hace es hacer más grande o pequeño el mundo en general, pero no sirve para esto. Si no se puede jugar sentado, ¿por qué mienten en la ficha? 

En realidad, con otros visores si se puede, además de Rift S tengo un WMR de HP, con estas como le indico desde la configuración del visor la altura que yo quiera, pues le pongo mi altura en la posición sentada, y entonces en el juego es como si estuviese de pie aun estando sentado. Pero quiero jugar con mi Rift S, que se ven mejor y el tracking es mejor, pero no puedo, a no ser que sea de pie, que no es por pereza, es por lo que he dicho antes. Rift S lleva ya unos cuantos meses en el mercado y sus desarrolladores no se han dignado en hacer nada, así que lo dicho, es un gran juego, pero le tengo que dar una opinión negativa.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970826049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1199, 'last_played': 1574701167}
review:
Really good VR Game. Great design, nice photo realism, good concept.  Puzzles range from the easy to very hard. Take it at your own pace.. no-gore or violence (at least so far). Maybe a little repetitive but with enough mystery to keep you going on. Bought on sale and very glad I did as I love these sorts of game. Portal lovers will probably love this. Its portal with a twist, as it it hadn't been twisted enough.

Pros.. Gave me a head ache.. a good headache.. the ache of cogs turning as some of this requires you to think quite hard about it. Really realistic design. Thought provoking in places. A couple of "WTF.. that's wicked" moments..

Cons.. the VR interface could be better. More of a port than a VR game - jumping is awful but thankfully workable.  Couple of gui bugs (annoyances) but nothing game breaking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014706658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1604864330}
review: great game. Relaxed gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970282042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1577752423}
review:
Bought this for flat screen originally and really liked it, but was undecided about getting the VR edition at the full price. But just happen to catch it on sale and took the plunge. Glad I did! Very immersive and so different actually standing right there in the game/puzzles. It seems weird and maybe cause have a good idea what to do, but certainly don't remember all the ways to  beat the puzzles, but actually seems easier seeing them right there in front of you. At least so far. 

Still probably worth it at full price if you already own the flat screen version, it is a fantastic deal on sale either way though. The sale only has 16 hours left at this time. So get it if was on the fence. It is fun and immersive.

The Controls are little harder to get use to from using the keyboard and mouse, but caught on pretty quickly. Using the Index so far has been easy. The default ones don't have jump so will see if need that functionality or not later, but so far not. The graphics and sound are amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019282902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1573483468}
review: Not quite ready for Index users yet. I am usually pretty good at picking up even complex control schemes for games but the Index controls are completely unintuitive and almost broken to the point of ruining the game for me. After much playing I eventually realised that I kept dying because I was hard grabbing objects which makes you teleport and causes you to drop what you grabbed. This usually resulted in a frustrating death. If the controls can be fixed (or at least made mappable by the user) then I would reconsider my review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970353098', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1588429237}
review:
Jeu de réflexion très intelligent dont la VR renforce l'approche de la question philosophique : qu'est-ce que la réalité ?
Je conseille vivement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041925998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 3278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1590084725}
review: Это тот же самый Талос. Мне показалось, что в ВР играть сложнее. Легче заблудиться, сложнее держать в голове карту местности, перемещение порталами не слишком удобно. И качество прорисовки. Ну... Мне не хватает. Но все же у меня даже мысли не было не покупать эту игру. Она прекрасна. Хотя за полную цену брать все же считаю неправильным, особенно если обычная версия уже тоже есть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027973295', 'num_games_owned': 1826, 'num_reviews': 1850, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1654989738}
review: Мне кажется, это лучшая игра для первого погружения в мир VR. Конечно, если вы любите философские адвенчуры.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965771914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3026, 'last_played': 1572464494}
review:
It's an amazing game and it works very well in VR (Oculus).
I'm lucky to be able to play it in full motion (smooth walking, smooth turning).

This game is and was the best in puzzles. Great environments, gorgeous soundtrack.
The puzzles are indeed challenging but they are fair.

If there is anything negative to say about it, then it's the replayability. But it turns out that I forget enough of the solutions to have another enjoyable go every two years or so. ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198796439329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1979, 'last_played': 1557110536}
review: I get lost in this game for hours...makes you find creative solutions to puzzles and is actually humorous to play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032632811', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 758, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1569899886}
review: A glitchy and uncomfortable way to play an otherwise clever, but drawn out and visually drab, puzzle game that gains no additional depth from operating in VR. Making this shabby port into a separate purchase presents a disorienting choice to incoming VR-compatible players. Seeing as puzzle games carry limited replayability once you know the answers, isolating each of the identical versions for players who are only going to own only one copy was a slightly degrading action. I wouldn’t look twice at the chance to play the original game with its appropriate interface and its (hopefully) more stable state, but it’d be odd to pay for the same game, on the same platform, with a different camera angle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024991594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1568423407}
review: Extremely hard on the eyes in VR on my Vive. Couldn't play for more than 15 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975387628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1580998835}
review:
I already owned the non-VR version, and I wrote a review of it. Since the exact same review still applies, I'm going to copy-paste it here. However, before that some comments about this VR version.

Firstly, for anybody who already owns the original non-VR version, be advised: This is *exactly* the same game as the original, with the exact same content. The only difference is that it's in stereoscopic VR, with VR controls. However, that being said, if it has been a long time since you played the original (as was my case) it may still be worth to grab this, in order to re-experience the game in VR.

Secondly, many people are saying in their reviews that this has poor support for Oculus Rift controllers. I don't understand what they are saying since that's not my experience at all. I have the Oculus Rift S, and the game plays perfectly with it. I have not noticed any issues of any kind.

The game can be controlled with the "teleporting" mechanic, or with the free-movement mechanic (ie. you move with the left joystick, as with any FPS game). The camera can be rotated with the right stick, either as normal, or in steps (45 degrees) for comfort. Personally I find this mode of control (free movement with left stick, rotation in steps with right stick) the best. (I do not suffer any sort of motion sickness in this mode, no matter how fast I move in game with the left stick.) It can be played sitting down or standing up. (I recommend a rotating chair, if sitting down.)

Given that the original game looks quite beautiful, and the VR version uses the same graphics, it makes this one of the best-looking VR games out there, which is really nice. It might need a relatively hefty PC to run smoothly, though (I myself have a high-end i9 CPU and a GTX 1080, and the game works very smoothly, with only really rare hiccups sometimes. They happen so rarely that they aren't bothersome.)

My original review of the non-VR game:

During the past few years I have played many, many games, the vast majority of them being mediocre, and even the best of them being just "ok". Too often have I felt that game developers are running out of ideas, or lack the talent to make a good idea into a great game... Too often have I felt that playing a game through is more a chore than a delight.

The Talos Principle, however, feels like a breath of fresh air. It has been a really long time since I have felt so enthralled by a video game, since I have been so involved and so addicted with a game that I have to play for hours to discover what new the game has to offer, since I have been so motivated to find every single secret, and solve every single puzzle even if optional.

Among countless mediocre and ok at best video games that inundate the market, The Talos Principle is certainly a gem. It might not be for everybody, but it certainly was for me.

If you liked Portal and Portal 2, chances are that you will like this. It's somewhat similar in gameplay and even in idea, but certainly without being a ripoff or clone in any significant way.

I cannot recommend this game highly enough. In my books it's one of the best games made in recent years. Heck, one of the best games ever. Definitely in my personal top 10 games of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273770465', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1432, 'last_played': 1681347750}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979631396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1573, 'last_played': 1614759558}
review:
This is one of those games where you get to the end (presumably) and decide not to finish until you've done everything else because you just don't want it to end. I still haven't climbed the tower. The Talos Principle must not apply.

The environment is perfect for VR. It can be hard to max out without reprojection though, so having an Index in 144hz mode really helps since then it drops to 72fps instead of 60 or if you have a Rift S what.. 40?(!)fps. I have a pretty powerful PC but without risking pop-in with the LoD, at native res, I still can't keep things at a lofty framerate without reprojection. Such is VR though. Having full finger control is pretty great too though and it works well.

My only complaints are the autotargeting of placing objects can suck, and having grip be Grab AND Jump was an odd decision. There's already the A button for Jump so I have accidentally moved while attempting to pick up an object dozens of times. Also needing to keep your finger on the track pad when placing sigils in the door puzzles seems like a bad holdover from Vive Wand controls.

Other than that this game has been one of my favorite experiences period.

Oh yeah and if you do try the game, just know the opening section gives a bad first impression. The first area is graphically the worst and the puzzles are simpler than need be. It picks up after you go up the elevator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030392645', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1552726872}

author: {'steamid': '76561198447580882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 3705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3705, 'last_played': 1568152069}
review: Ho affrontato questa esperienza nella modalità VR con Oculus Rift e l'ho adorato. E' un gioco che probabilmente non avrei mai acquistato per giocarci su monitor, sbagliando, poichè la trama è un qualcosa di intrigante, profondo e toccante. Inutile dire che giocato in prima persona è stato fantastico poichè la grafica è una delle migliori che ho provato sin ora su VR (1080 impostando tutto a palla) e soprattutto è un gioco con ambientazioni che lasciano spesso a bocca aperta, con musiche di atmosfera anche se ripetitive a volte. Non essendo un gioco frenetico dove c'è da sparare me lo sono goduto appieno sfruttando il movimento libero (soffro pochissimo il motion sickness) dando così un senso di immersività impareggiabile e le ore che ci ho giocato lo dimostrano. Da dicembre ho scaricato molti altri giochi per vr, di vario genere, ma questo mi ha tenuto incollato più degli altri, che per un motivo o per l'altro ho abbandonato dopo un ora. Ho finito ieri anche il dlc e merita tantissimo pure lui, specialmente per le vertigini che mi ha fatto provare facendo certi salti..chi non ha provato mai un VR non può capire cosa si prova a buttarsi nel vuoto da un ponte, seppur virtuale! E' un genere che non avevo mai provato e sono rimasto sorpreso perchè il senso di appagamento nel risolvere gli enigmi è stato notevole e la frustrazione si è presentata di rado. Se avete un VR non fatevelo scappare, probabilmente a livello di immersività e appagamento grafico non esiste di meglio sul mercato, a patto di non abbandonarlo alle prime difficoltà, perchè la storia si fa intrigante dopo qualche ora. I brividi che mi ha regalato non li dimenticherò!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047294457', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1568160615}

author: {'steamid': '76561198051468974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1989, 'last_played': 1703537364}
review:
First off, I've had the pleasure to enjoy this experience on the Oculus Rift CV1 paired with an RTX 2070. Runs well enough, especially given the sorcery that is asynchronous timewarp.

I mean sure, whenever I looked on the backside off my right hand there was a huge black rectangle blocking basically everything, the controls were unintuitive at best and somewhere around 20hrs in a patch landed reconfiguring the controls which I had internalized by then. Go figure. 

Now, just after 33 hours, I'm pretty positive I've got all sigils and stars from the main game as well as Road to Gehenna. You could say I've made it to the hall of fame, which took me quite by surprise.
But let's be honest, I had to look up the eagle's landing just like everyone else. The rest was all me, though.

But all in all, what's my verdict? The VR implementation feels rushed and unpolished, the puzzles are not for everyone and some can be quite maddening. The story will not allow you to major in any kind of philosophics course and coop is basically just you playing with yourself. 
You here for any of that? Well, buy it anyways, keep your mind open, answer as you actually would when asked and just be part of the world you'll find yourself in. You might just learn something or another about yourself. I sure did.
And even though the graphics are quite a bit dated nowadays; the visuals are plain stunning. Same goes for the amazing soundtrack. And the terminals. Especially the terminals.

These 33 hours will not be my final time for this experience. I still need to take a friend with me, even though he declined the first time around; and I'll try not to be as stubborn with strangers in far lands from now on.
But for now? I think @ has the right idea. I'm just going to rest here for a while, enjoy the tranquility.

review:
Absolument génial.
Voilà comment un bon jeu, devient encore meilleur en VR !

Belle progression sur les énigmes, d'abord très accessibles puis se complexifient petit à petit.
Une histoire très bien écrite (bravo pour l'adaptation française) qui fait encore plus de sens à vivre en VR.
Des décors magnifiques à explorer.
Une très bonne ambiance sonore, avec les musiques qui accompagnent parfaitement.

Sur Oculus les libs natives sont utilisées, donc plus grande fluidité.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990914884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1566532400}
review:
Best starter VR game if you are looking to get your VR legs. This title has so many options besides teleportation: Zoom, blink Teleport, controller style movement with vignetting, and of course the goal which is the same without the vignetting. 

Also the game itself is amazing. Great assets that were designed as objects rather than flat textures make a game look better on a monitor, but in VR this truly brings a world to life.

Like Portal, this is a puzzle game that puts a focus on the story and world. 
Progression is the famous Mario 64 style that is yet to be beat, allowing you to move on to new worlds but comeback later for the more difficult 'stars'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198384348844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 36618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12188, 'last_played': 1640299940}
review: 200 hours on this game, and enjoyed all of them. Fantastic game with fair (and sometimes difficult) puzzles. There are 40 to 60 puzzles total in which you must incorporate signal jammers, force field screens, power connecters in three separate worlds (and ancient cultures).  World B was my favourite by far.  I would've liked to have seen some Inca or Aztec ruins too and jungle features, but hey, it's great as it is still. The storyline is weak, and there were times I wanted to smash the computers. Also, after 25 similar puzzles, they do start to wear on you but I was glad that at least they were all different from puzzle to puzzle. Kind of like Mexican food: same ingredients- different dish. Regardless, I spent my two week vacation (Master's in Addiction Counseling) playing this game and had a blast. One of the best gaming experiences I've ever had. I waited until it was 50% off, so it was definitely worth the money. Here's a tip for you: if you want to buy a game at a reduced price, put it on your wishlist. (Every game I've ever wishisted has gone on sale within just a few weeks afterwards.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198016685578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1685109628}
review:
Wo fange ich an? 
01.: Die Grafik auf der W.M.R sieht spitze aus.
02.: Die Sprachaugabe in Deutsch ist super Klasse. (Ein Lob an die Synchronsprecher und Tonstudio, steht dem Originale in Nichts nach.)
03.: Die Steurung lässt sich wirklich sehr gut konfigurieren, alle Wünsche offen.
04.: Für Knobelfans ist an alles gedacht, bisher kaum Zeitlimits, man kann sich alles genau anschauen.
05.: Es basiert weitesgehenst auf physikalischer Basis. (Kein Kreuzen von Lichtstrahlen, etc.) Also alles logisch wie ich es liebe.
06.: Es wird eine Geschichte darum erzählt, da kommt wieder die Vertonung ins Spiel.
07.: Man merkt das mit der gegeben Welt was nicht stimmt, alâ Matrix also "forscht" man weiter.
08.: Die Idee mit den C64 am jeweiligen Level Start (oder ähnliches) den man abfragen kann verdichtet die Story.
09.: Man wird "seicht" in die kommenden Aufgaben invulviert, kein "Was ist das denn jetzt?"
10.: Obwohl wenig erklärt wird wie es denn nun weiter geht ist das Einfinden in da Spiel sehr gut gemacht.
11.: Zwar wohl kein Open World aber abzulaufen um ein paar Goodies abzugreifen ist da. (Man freut sich diebisch wenn man wa gefunden hat was nicht auf der Karte ist.)
12.: Kann ich echt empfehlen! War ja ein "Form" Fan und darüber kam nichts. Ich revediere meine Meinung.
Wer "Form" mal gespielt hat und eine "bodenständige" Alternative sucht wird hier fündig.
Das Spiel macht einfach nur Laune, sogar am Abend knobble ich rum wie es wohl weiter geht.
Und das bei diesen Temperaturen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075297496', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1561060986}
review: nice

author: {'steamid': '76561198025002322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1559199046}
review: Puzzle games about spatial reasoning are easier in VR, where spatial perception is enhanced by head tracking and stereo vision, but they are also more fun. This is a very good adaptation of a 3D first-person discrete elements puzzle game. The story is interesting, but sadly has nothing left to reveal at the conclusion if you're been reading all the text logs. There are a few things that really should be fixed (entity movement speed  doesn't scale to user-selected VR comfort max player speed) and a few things that can't be fixed (magic holes in walls that somehow won't let object be picked up through them) but overall this is a solid puzzle game with a satisfying length.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038162732', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1578283088}
review: I'm honestly pretty satisfied with the VR experience of this game, while the control scheme is something I do not prefer, you do get used to it over time. If people like smooth locomotion which is sliding around, there you go. If sliding around bothers you, you can teleport. As for rotation, it's about the same situation, snap turning or smooth turning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008307996', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1119, 'last_played': 1561651775}
review:
The short bit:

This is one of those games where the less you know about it, the better it will be.

It has physics puzzles, jigsaw puzzles, and some puzzles you really need to think outside the box to solve.

If you like those things, this is definitely worth a go.


The technical details:

i played with an oculus rift, and i did find i had to change graphic settings to swap the game from using Steamvr to using the oculus one in order to unlock the ability to jump, as some puzzles are impossible without it. bear this in mind if you have one also.

For movement, the game has some options you can choose, from basic point and teleport to classic analog, i did not get motion sickness from this but i ended up using teleport anyway simply because it was quicker, but i think this gave me an unfair advantage in time limited puzzles.

There is some comfort options to help those who get motion sick easily, but i ended up disabling them because all they really did was limit my vision and cause confusion with unexpected camera changes.

You can change the scale of the world, making the world smaller so you can reach higher things while sat down, which i did because i am too lazy to stand up, but could be a very helpful feature for those who cant stand up.


The negatives:

i had trouble with some puzzles, not because i couldn't figure them out, not because they were very complicated or difficult to pull off, but because the way the game lets you move objects can be unreliable.

It works by displaying a silhouette of the object you're holding where you point your controller, sometimes with the silhouette being directly on top of puzzle objects if you point at it.

I solved some puzzles way to early because for some reason an item i was trying to place ended up on a pressure plate behind a wall i couldn't see, opening up the prize room early and pretty much ruining the puzzle.

i ended up outright unable to solve some puzzles because an item phased through a wall after being placed and ended up out of the map bounds, and sometimes even inside a different puzzle room, making that one stupidly easy.

i spent way too long on simple puzzles because the item just would not plant where i wanted, even though it's placement silhouette is where i wanted it. 
[spoiler]Moving platforms are unnecessarily difficult to put items on[/spoiler]

Dispute these small yet highly infuriating problems, i still recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193343433', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1561022958}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039376989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3838, 'last_played': 1546203311}
review: solid game, one of the best VR titles I have played. Very pretty graphics, Interesting and sometimes difficult puzzles, with a lot of lore, and easter eggs to break things up. The puzzles could be frustrating, but for the most part they didn't make me want to cheat or look up the answer, but leave and come back later. It's open world so you can always try other puzzles and come back later. Often times I would come back and get it right away. You can even find workarounds on occasion. One gripe I have is that I played standing up, and all the reading and text dialog and tetris style puzzles became uncomfortable even exhausting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049165831', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1556732792}
review: Ho giocato due ore. Dove 90 minuti sono a cercare di trovare settaggi dove riesco ad avere un'esperienza ad almeno 50 fps... Ogni 15 secondi stuttering e stuttering. Letteralmente ingiocabile. Eppure il primo avvio in assoluto girava perfettamente...

author: {'steamid': '76561198288914820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1562429442}
review:
Purchased game in anticipation of using my new index controllers with it, but appears completely broken with them (hands don't even show up).  This game is still listed on valve's controller page as a game with special updates to "take advantage of the new controllers for launch" 

Solid game otherwise.  Great environments, great puzzles!  Just know that your new controllers will not work at all even when mucking with the bindings yourself.

Update: Still no working support for Index Controllers with the latest update.  Controllers show up in game now which is new (not hands), but still are unresponsive and you can't click to start the game.

Update2: Had to trick the game by using one wand and one index controller and flip between different bindings before getting things to work...but they do seem OK now.  Index support still seems rather shaky.
developer_response:
Hi Phatfish,
sorry you were having issues. However, we just updated the game with Index support so please try after the update.

Cheers,
Danny

author: {'steamid': '76561197993716743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1575209451}
review: One of the best puzzle games I've played (a lot like portal in a way). Graphics are crisp and puzzles are logic based. Alas there is currently a bug which prevents the player from jumping onto anything (controller issue with the rift), I'm sure they'll fix it soon so I can finish certain area's. Nevertheless, I never felt buggy otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277840358', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1560910486}
review: This game is great for relaxing and just solving so puzzles. Sometime thing can seem to be very hard but then after figuring them out make the rest of the level super easy which is a great feeling. I would highly recommend this game to newer VR player or to introduce VR to a friend .

author: {'steamid': '76561197994428768', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1685039802}
review:
アクションパズルゲームです。

通常版をクリア済みの感想です。
このゲームは好きなのでセールで即買いしました。
何か追加要素あるかなーと思っていたのですが、
VRを足した形でしたので、どちらか一方を買えばよいかと思います。

操作性は通常版の方が良いです。talos専用コントローラーがあれば別ですが・・・
それとは逆にゲームの世界観に入る没入感は比較にならないので、
操作性のストレスはそこまで感じないかと思います。
アクションとは言いつつも、アクション性要素はほぼ無いので、
綺麗な風景を眺めながら、ゆっくり考えて楽しめるゲームです。

初めて買う方は定価でもオススメ出来ます。
それぐらいのボリュームがありますよ。
セールなら尚更買いですね。
興味ある方は是非買って挑戦してみて下さい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198048263568', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1560451281}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016018595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1560348303}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120070158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1674928666}
review:
"You've played 13 hours". 13 hours of which 12 hours are fiddling with the GPU settings. You think you have finally found a combination that is stutter free, then voila, next level and there is stuttering again.
I have a gtx 1070 but it should be able to handle TTP at decent settings, but any form of AA is out of the question so you have to love jaggies, and dynamic lightning is also out of the question regardless of if you put the settings at the lowest possible. 
It's funny because if you use the auto config then MSAA is enabled but with AA on the game is unplayable in any resolution.
The game itself is great, but the gaming experience is very far from fluid because of all the time you have to spend in the settings.
It's depressing that VR has been ruined by poor development. I haven't bought a VR game in a long time because I always read before buying and it's mostly the same story in reviews, poor performance regardless of what developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019146766', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1560283586}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197967448717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1574623521}
review: looks good play's well in VR  good story .

author: {'steamid': '76561197993531965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1545535319}
review:
Pretty straight forward... It's the Talos Principle in VR
I only have this version of the game and I don't regret it.
Not much to do except the puzzles and explore the small islands. But it's still fun.
The story tidbits are amusing to read and pop up on terminals and hidden plaques and other terminals in the various zones.
Boils down to a "fruit of the forbidden tree" story very quickly, but its got a nice feel to it and it doesn't seem forced.
I use an Oculus Rift with touch controllers and the interface works just fine without issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962741350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1036, 'last_played': 1553903423}
review:
I bought this without knowing anything about the game. As a VR puzzle game this is excellent. The use of force fields, lasers, drones, and time travel really work well together. The scenery is also quite beautiful, the mix of technology in the historical settings is quirky but interesting.

However the story is utter trash.

I completed the game and I enjoyed the increasing challenge of the puzzles. I couldn't care less about the spiritual/existential/deity nonsense in the story. I probably won't play the DLC because of this, nor would I be interested in the rumoured sequel.

Despite my positive recommendation for the VR puzzles, I would never have bought the game if I knew about the story. A different, modern style like the Portal games would have much better suited these technology based puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198850989281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1619333345}
review: I'm about 80% through and really liking this game. The puzzles increase in difficulty at a rate that always keeps me engaged. I haven't played the non-VR version before so I can't make a comparison between the two, but I can say I haven't encountered any bugs in 14 hours of playing and the whole experience feels really natural and immersive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084329921', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1546257051}
review:
Не буду говорить [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TuTAH_1/recommended/257510]про саму игру[/url] в этом обзоре, скажу про реализацию VR.
Настроек VR очень много, но они не переведены; есть даже поддержка API, за что разработчикам отдельное спасибо. Отмечу сразу немногочисленные минусы:
● Телепорт в некоторых головоломках является читерным: можно нажать на кнопку для вентилятора и и телепортироваться на этот вентилятор – он подбросит вас. Но таких ситуаций очень мало. В DLC я встречал такое 2-4 раза, учитывая звёзды
● Гораздо более важным является изучение мира – некоторые QR-коды не читаются, за F8 E8 F4 F0 EE E2 E0 ED ED FB E9 20 F2 E5 EA ст удобно читать используя телефон, а в VR-шлеме это очень неудобно
● На определенных настройках графики [spoiler](уже не помню каких, что-то связанное с тенями)[/spoiler], [url=https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xvc-DJ6j8CZeK88LiwC9KT1tERF-MBe1/view?usp=sharing]некоторые объекты[/url] на одном глазу чёрные, на другом – нет (наверное, вы понимаете, что на такой объект больно смотреть)

Но в целом главные особенности этой игры для меня: красота и EC E8 F0 – в VR стали ещё ярче, поэтому эту единственную удачную (на данный момент) переделку под VR от Croteam я рекомендую

author: {'steamid': '76561198052633453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1552833202}
review:
It gave me a massive headache and I felt dizzy after playing it for like few hours. Strange as no VR game has done that to me before and I tried quite a few.

Having said that (and it will not affect my review rating) the game did not impress me at all. I only have nearly an hour on clock but beat many puzzles during this time which were very easy and I did not enjoy them at all - they did not give a grain of satisfaction after resolving. 

Maybe puzzle games just aren't my thing. The game started off okay but then was very boring and repetitive. Don't understand the hype at all.


Not my cup of tea.


3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996000877', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1554154670}
review:
This game is stellar, and the VR port of this game has every single accessibility option you could ever want. Teleport controls, regular movement, smooth turning, snap turning. Friendly to left-handed people, too.

However, it remains a VR port. Having it in VR does not add all that much to the experience. Still, it sure as hell beats the VR tech demos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039915165', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1577401984}
review: This is a great game so far; first zen vr game that I found truly fun and refreshing to play. The puzzle made me actually think a little bit so far :D but none too hard yet. I am hoping one stumps me for a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129771193', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 2714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2019, 'last_played': 1557540196}
review:
Quite a good puzzle game. It's a port to VR, but still makes use of motion controllers. Given that it's a puzzle game though, the additional immersiveness of VR doesn't add as much to the game as something like Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice. It's still worth playing in VR, but I wouldn't bother buying the VR version if you already have the non-VR version.

A warning for achievement hunters: leaving the terminals till the end may make it faster to get all achievements, but the game is *much* more enjoyable if you read them as you go.

Pros:
- Uses tracked motion controllers
- Movement is heavily customizable, supporting both teleport and traditional movement, snap and smooth turning, and reducing FOV to prevent motion sickness
- Includes the DLC
- The difficulty curve from easy puzzles to harder ones is good
- Lots to explore and find, with multiple endings possible
- There are backups automatically created that you can restore to get other ends/achievements without having to replay the whole game
- I thoroughly enjoyed the story, especially the audio logs
- Road to Gehenna is a brilliant addition

Cons:
- I found the elevator buttons to be really finicky to push
- Towards the end the tetromino puzzles get really large and difficult. Personally I didn't enjoy them so I ended up just using a guide to get past them. I'm not sure how this could be improved though.

Verdict: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197989784474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1577695248}
review:
No Journal in the VR version while still having prompts telling you that something is now available in the Journal is a slap in the face.

Also no button remapping is really annoying as the grab is mapped to triggers while every other Oculus thing has it in the grip buttons.

Together with all the little annoyances like this it doesn't feel like a finished product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084611990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1619642430}
review: Es un juego que engancha. Los puzzles son muy buenos y originales, y el mundo por el que te mueves es enorme, empieza siendo reducido, pero cada vez se agranda más y más conforme descubres la historia. Muy recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127450166', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1551805276}
review:
Great game. I played a few houres of the non-VR and absolutely loved it. Then i saw this game on sale and also saw that the Serious Sam VR bundle (Which i was going to buy) was only 50cents cheaper than the Croteam VR bundle that included all Serious Sam VR games + The Talos Principle VR so i thought i might give it a try in VR. Teleportation weirdly gave me a headache but walking locomotion works fine for me.
It allows you to transfer over your Non-VR save (only from non-VR to VR and not in the other direction). 
The VR version feels way better. The immersion you get from VR is great for puzzle games (epecially ones that look this great) and it is all portet perfectly.
I don't know how long the game is but it is a port from a non-VR game so it is on the longer side (I played 5 houres and am no where near the end). The VR version also adds the DLC "Road to Gehenna" for free.
It would honestly be worth the asking price for me but if you are sceptical you can wait for a sale (it is usually around 5€ 
when its on sale)
A must have for anyone who like puzzle games (i got it because i loved solving puzzles in Portal) and it gets quite challenging at times (Eventhough I'm only 5 houres in). I dont want to talk too much about the story but lets just say it gives you something to think about when you are stuck in puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994209383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1777, 'last_played': 1614094737}
review:
В мониторной версии мне было скучно и я просто не дошел до первого терминала, который зажигает любопытство.
В VR же мои глаза и разум стали открыты. Сидеть на земле или камне, уставившись в пустоту, после очередного подгона от терминала\памяти просто бесценно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017115308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1560, 'last_played': 1552610973}

author: {'steamid': '76561198389205946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 7793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7590, 'last_played': 1569522247}
review: Quel jeu fantastique!  Des heures de plaisir!  Si vous aimez résoudre des problèmes, c'est le jeu qu'il vous faut.  Les univers sont magnifiques, il y a vraiment beaucoup de tableaux et des niveaux bonus.  Plus de 100 heures sur ces deux jeux, ca vaut vraiment l'investissement.  On l'a acheté lorsqu'il était en spécial et meme au prix régulier on estime qu'il vaut la peine d'être acheté.  En espérant qu'il va y en avoir un autre dans le même genre bientôt!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973699241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1639785329}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995886593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1463, 'last_played': 1554949550}
review: Definitely very cool game! I bought it on sale but it's worth the full price. Lots of hours of gameplay. Never thought I'd have this much fun solving puzzles. 5-Stars for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045894360', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1550045241}
review: If a game cant draw me in within 5 minutes sorry but its not good. My first impression was horrible graphics and a horrible locomotion system. Im suppose to go around grabbing laser cameras and deactivating shit? No Thanks. Maybe this was cool when it came out. VR has come a long way and this game is full of vr "unpotential" Save yourself time and dont buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300682951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1552085661}
