author: {'steamid': '76561197972374662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1680576094}
review:
I'm going to make this easy.  
Like puzzles, but not puzzle rooms?  
Like being plopped in the middle of a story with no idea who, what or why you are?
Like smooth running VR games that don't involve jumpscares or running like hell from demons?
Like a little philosophy in your games?

Then buy this game.  Now.
Then prepared to get lost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142551628', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2066, 'last_played': 1700233376}
review:
This is a really enjoyable logic puzzle game that works great in VR. The game is huge compared to many VR offerings! I found some of the puzzles very tricky but not utterly impossible. There was always a feeling that if you took a break and rethought it, you'd eventually get there.

There's also an interesting back story and reason for you being in the game that's told through clues left on terminals  that are scattered throughout the world.

I totally recommend the game for all VR users.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013258260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3393, 'last_played': 1697758307}
review: I got this in the bundle on sale but after playing it  I would pay way more if I did not luck out. Great game with hours of game play. Puzzles range in dfficulty from very easy to hard. Several times I finished a puzzle and thought how did I not get this way sooner. Music/soundtrack was repetative without seaming so and was very good at setting the mood. I can't judge the story as I did not dive deeply into it. I liked the way they story or narative was delivered and I plan to spend a bunch more time in the vr game even after finishing it. Some have complained about the control scheam but I was using WMR and found it very easy to control there are some changes available in the options menu if you want to find somthing more suited to your liking. I doubt they will read this but Thank you to all the people responsible for creating this game and to those who put in the effort to getting running in VR. Job well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345553779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1548104788}
review:
The Talos Principle is a game I really like. Although not exactly free of violence it offers several days of more and more challenging puzzles, realistic graphics which I liked, quite a few things to think about and an interesting background story ... oh, and quite a few funny easter eggs. Almost the perfect game for me.

It's also one of few games offered as VR and non-VR version. I'll concentrate on the question whether bying the VR version is worth the money. Short answer is: Not bad but I prefer the non-VR version.

[u]In detail:[/u]
The developers at Croteam have created a rock-solid VR implementation of the original game. In contrast to other VR games I did not encounter any technical issues with the controllers, startup issues or such with my Windows MR headset. Moreover they offer an astonishing level of customization of the controls and the ways of movement. (I prefer continous movement, but discrete turing at 45° angles, for instance.) The game works smooth on my GeForce 1050 Ti with relatively high graphics settings (higher than auto-detected).

The VR experience however is mixed bag. Yes, the ability to look around is nice, but this is not needed often for the game itself. Certainly not when running through narrow corridors within puzzles. What's more important then is a snappy navigation. And that's a problem: If I don't configure different controllers I constantly inadvertedly turn instead of running straight, so I bump into walls too often. The discrete turning makes loosing orientation easy (but using continuous rotation makes me go crazy immediately). Given that in later levels movement speed and precision are crucial (e.g. when moving between hovering mines) the VR version makes the game harder than it should be.

What's more, some of the easter eggs where you pick things up [spoiler](such as a message in a bottle")[/spoiler] simply don't work for me with VR. The game doesn't let me grab anything from close to the ground. Poking the PC terminal's on/off switch with the finger is also less fun than it sounds. Grabbing or manipulating the environment doesn't feel half as convincing as in games like "Moss". 

Then there is this issue that the sky box is wrong (its actually closer than far-away trees or buildings). Not a big thing, and there is a thread with a simple fix for this from a user, but this should be corrected by Croteam together with Steam VR. Leaves or other small objects in the background seem to waver slightly and I found no graphics setting to improve this.

So what do you gain with VR? An only slightly more "immersive" feeling with 3D effect, but at the cost of a more difficult game-play, lower-resolution graphics and louder graphics card fans. And you have to wear these glasses for a long time to finish this game. I felt, I had enough after few hours.

Verdict: I recommend playing the non-VR version unless you need something to justify your VR glasses purchase ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993073260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1497, 'last_played': 1578250483}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968783827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1547161841}
review:
Fantástico, muy adictivo, si te van los puzzles este es tu juego.
Todas las mecánicas, la estética, las voces (en inglés al menos) muy bien elegidas, la ambientación... Me trae mucho recuerdos de la época de Myst... cuantas horas jugadas!!
He de probar todos los modos de locomoción, de momento solo he probado el Teleport con anmación, sin problemas ni efectos de mareo.

En resumen es una gran adquisición para la VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111052796', 'num_games_owned': 977, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1547132149}
review: Не рекомендую. Крайне кривая адаптация под шлемы ВР. Если хотите получить удовольствие от  прекрасной игры - играйте в ее оригинал. Небрежное перемещение персонажа выполненно через плохо реализованное управление и неаккуратную телепортацию. Руки-стики, больше выступают как условный элемент. Нажатие и взаимодействие с рычагами не требуют прямого касания - просто направьте луч и нажмите кнопку. Интерфейс, приятно восхищающий в исходнике здесь спроецирован на обычный плейн. Утерян основной фактор UX. И низкое качество графики как итог небрежного портирования.

author: {'steamid': '76561198855619045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1590374207}
review: This is a deep and enthralling VR experience. For those of you who find pleasure in deep logic and yearn for a visceral VR world, go for this. It combines AI with philosophy, logic, and scenery in a breathtaking way. This blend makes VR essential rather than just an option for these types of games. Well done Croteam.

review: Part puzzle compilation, part exploration into philosophy.  The puzzles weren't too bad, but they increase in difficulty pretty swiftly near the end.  The narrative is very thought provoking, and the VR visuals for the final puzzles are pretty breathaking, though a "fear of heights" warning is probably warranted.  Still, great game and I'm glad I took the journey.  Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974428105', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1546136157}
review:
The Talos Principle is a great game. A truly spectacular piece of gaming craftmanship, and looking at the other reviews I appear to be in a minority, but I do not think this game has transferred to VR well at all. I went into this game expecting to relive the original Talos adventure and was left wanting. 

The original version let you smoothly walk through the world allowing you to slowly take in the world around you and let it sweep you up in it's tranquility. In contrast the lurching leaps of the teleport system totally shatterred this feeling for me making moving through the game world feel frantic and violent. WASD movement in the original game meant you could change direction quickly, you could strafe to look around corners from a safe difference. The games levels are perfectly designed and wonderfully envisioned, but they were never designed for VR movement systems. 

 The beauty of the mechanics of the original game was in it's simplicity, move around, pick things up, put them down. This simplicity is there in VR but means that there isn't much to do within the VR setting. You can play this game one handed if you want, sans the minor difference of a little bit of aiming with the various items.

The beauty in this game was always stunning but I was already stunned by the spaces the devs created to bring about this game, and while seeing the temple in VR was beautiful I had already been stunned, it was better but honestly? I had hoped for more.

The Talos Principle is a fantastic game. If you have never played it before, get it. Get it and with fresh eyes you probably won't see any of the problems I have and you will have a truly fun puzzler with an immensely touching story in your hands. If you have played and loved the original, you may find yourself immersed in the game in full 3D, but feeling less connected to it than ever. 

What a shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013844936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 2181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1229, 'last_played': 1597504538}
review:
The motion controls for this game are superbly smooth. The devs obviously put a lot of time and effort into getting them right so that even a VR newbie like me can cope with the step locomotion. The locomotion configuration has lots of settings you can change independently of each other so you can set things up exactly the way you want them. The one complaint I have, and it is very minor, is that locomotion speed is hidden under game settings instead of VR controls. There don’t seem to be any limits to roomscale support. I have a pretty small area, but I was able to move around inside it freely and even walk off ledges. Walking into a wall is pretty weird though. Talos doesn’t let you clip through walls via roomscale, so it feels kind of like my brain ran into a wall even though the rest of me is still walking. This isn’t a complaint, Talos handles walls well. Other games let you clip into or through walls, and it is terrible. I’m really impressed with how well locomotion was implemented in Talos; I wish all games would give their movement systems as much polish.

I spent most of the day playing it and haven’t cleared all of the first set of puzzles yet, so it seems like there’s a fair amount of content. Some of the earlier puzzles were too easy; however, difficulty ramped up quickly. The primary puzzles in the game have to be solved to collect sigils. In addition to these puzzles, there are also much more difficult optional puzzles. These puzzles are not just hard, but they’re often hidden and the game doesn’t inform you that they even exist until you solve the first. This is a great way to scale the puzzle difficulty so that players new to puzzle games can still enjoy the game and make progress while providing truly mind bending challenges for hardcore enthusiasts.

In addition to the two main puzzle types, there are also a number of messages secreted around the world adding an exploration and discovery layer on top of the puzzles. The challenge puzzles being largely hidden also provides an incentive to look in every nook and cranny.

The terrain looks gorgeous. Trees look like trees and grass looks like grass, even when you get up close. The sky just looks right for the most part and the way Talos handles horizons is fantastic. I don’t want to spoil what happens when you try to walk off into the distance, but it completely fits the game’s tone. You definitely should give it a try when you play it. The sculpture and walls are admittedly lacking in detail, but that just means they support the narrative of being in an artificial world even better than they would if they looked entirely real.

Throughout, the developer’s devotion to producing an excellent game shines through. There are so many fantastic little details. The popup display embedded in your wrist that tracks items you recover as you solve puzzles is genius. As are the signposts that indicate which puzzles have been solved and all the ways the game provides information about what areas have or have not been fully cleared while still encouraging exploring every nook and cranny.

Bottom line: I booted it up intending to play for just 15 minutes and only stopped playing an hour and a half later because I got hungry. This is VR done right. If you haven’t played it yet, you’re cheating yourself out of a fantastic experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985851570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1631975581}
review:
Wow, just wow... I have had my eyes on this game for a long time but never could have imagined that it was this good. If I would have known then I would have bought it years ago. I can't remember when I was this awestruck by a game. Hats off to the developers!

UPDATE:
I just wanted to come back to my review and update my thoughts about it now that I finished playing the game. This game is like a book that you can't put away, a truly philosophical journey that goes beyond the puzzles and hits you with it's beautiful scenery, music score and atmosphere. Don't be in a hurry when playing this game, and definitely don't expect an action packed experience. This is all about tranquility and thoughtfulness. Sure, there are areas that this game can improve, like reduce the number of repetition of puzzles, and make the "story" a bit shorter so that it's possible to play it through in say sub 8 hours. It doesn't have to be long to be good.  Anyway, I will definitely return to this game again and finish it a second time since it will be like reading a good book or re-watching a good movie. A big thanks to the guys and girls behind this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198872343896', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2656, 'last_played': 1549665535}
review: Wow! This game should be a finalist for best VR Game. For sheer depth and value it's unbeatable right now. Well designed puzzles have kept me engrossed for two full days of VR pleasure. The difficulty gets harder with the more experience you gain, that continues to stretch you and there is huge satisfaction upon completing some of the more difficult levels. Great all-round game design which has been thoughtfully and carefully optimised for the VR version. Highly recommended and insane value in the sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140299850', 'num_games_owned': 2332, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 6908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2404, 'last_played': 1569230268}
review:
I intend to write something far more detailed about The Talos Principle VR soon, but I see several friends have this on their wishlist, and I feel the need to express something before the sale ends.

I played the regular version to the level of 22 achievements, and loved it very much (but accepted my limits.) But the VR version is a whole new ballgame, and I suspect I won't be quitting so easily this time. While the VR navigation takes a bit of getting use to (and I believe a tutorial not so much in movement, but in nuance would be VERY helpful) the "Talos World" is simply an amazing place, and one that I hate to ever leave. I'm not sure if my increased success is due to more puzzle game experience in the interim, or the fact that VR is simply more "there", but in A level alone I gained at least three sigils that eluded me before (and in fact have them all, and with zero assistance.)

Please, if the money is the issue, $6 (USD) is almost a gift in itself, and I think I can assure anyone wondering that they will never regret the expense. And if you played before, the experience alone is stunning enough to eliminate feelings of repetition.

Admittedly, I'm new to VR, but this is what I always fantasized that VR would be. All I have to do for maximum enjoyment is sit on the couch, and on rare occasions stand up for a little extra height. No effort, and a world I can believe in for an amazing price.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077723254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1545757870}
review: Se avessi potuto dare un voto neutro glielo avrei dato... che dire,se siete fan dei rompicapo non lasciatevelo sfuggire...,ma se non lo siete e avete poca pazienza come me lasciate stare...anche se lo trovate in sconto. Io l'ho trovato parecchio frustrante, forse anche per la mancanza di un tutorial...forse avrebbe aiutato il gameplay che già dall'inizio per chi è a digiuno come me in questo genere, avrebbe potuto aiutare. Voglio dare un giudizio negativo per ristabilire un po di equilibrio anche se ha riscosso molto successo...ma quello che volevo sottolineare è che non è un gioco per tutti e per me è  sopravvalutato, anche perchè  un gioco veramente quotato soddisfa un po tutti i generi di giocatori...a me ad esempio non mi ha soddisfatto, mi ha fatto solo innervosire. Probabilmente se non lo avessi preso in sconto lo avrei restituito...ma per circa 5 euro può stare li tra la mia collezione...chissà che mi torni la voglia di riprovarlo...

author: {'steamid': '76561198084674911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1545603656}
review: I SO wanted to like this game. It's a beautiful concept that, in my opinion, is very poorly executed.  The puzzles are challenging and for the most part fun and I wanted to know more!  But what makes this not recommended for me is the fact that you have to wander thru a freaking maze to find the puzzle doors/gateway/path.  On my first 45min play, I found it very annoying and felt that it detracted from the fun I had just had solving the puzzles.  I put the game aside and restarted my quest, to give it another shot, the next day.  Again, I found the puzzles very entertaining but the most time I spent in the game was going back and forth thru the maze to find the areas with the puzzle pieces I needed and then back to the main area to open a gate.  I found it all even more frustrating than the first time because this game would have been INFINITELY better without having to go thru that.  A simple, central portal or menu would have been perfect to get the player from section to section.  Very frustrating because I wanted to like it but ultimately, Refunded

author: {'steamid': '76561198036083044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1545541040}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973021945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1545532923}
review:
This is another situation where a game would be better served by a more nuanced rating system. I'm not giving a negative review because the game is trash. I'm giving a negative review because it's the honest answer to the question: "Do you recommend this game?" I do not. Here is why:

Movement is exactly the opposite of intuition--as is interaction:

Grip button to teleport; trigger to grab.

There is also no option to rebind these to be more logical.

Further, this is the first VR game where teleporting made me motion-sick. Usually the teleport option is to avoid motion sickness, but that doesn't work when there is stuttering in the middle.

And as a final insult, the teleport scheme itself is lousy--though perhaps I was just spoiled for teleporting systems because my first VR game was Robo Recall--but it makes for a good point of comparison to understand what makes The Talos Principle's teleporting so lousy.

In Robo Recall, you use the thumbsticks to set up your teleporting, with additional aiming by pointing. The thumbstick also serves to set what your facing will be at the end of the jump. This makes it simple and intuitive to BAMF! around, changing your facing to be what you want or need it to be at the other end of the jump. Teleporting three feet ahead but facing the opposite direction is effortless and natural.

Here, in The Talos Principle, your facing is locked during teleportation. To change facing, you use the thumbsticks. The default is to rotate in 45 degree increments.

For much of the game, that's fine, if a bit inconvenient. Where it falls apart is when you have to actively avoid a patrol--which happens pretty early on. It means that any action that requires you to outpace a threat more difficult, because your facing will be off--and you will likely find yourself getting turned around in real space because it's so much more instinctive to turn your body to deal with the problem.

That last probably isn't much of a problem if you have a roomscale setup. But if your play area is smaller, or if you're trying to play seated, it can be the difference between making it through a puzzle, and starting over. I only have a half hour of playtime, but in that time, it happened a couple times--I ended up being killed mid-puzzle because the controls were in my way.

This isn't exactly a frantic game. But it manages to be challenging in a similar manner simply because the controls don't work the way one might expect if you come from other VR games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966323294', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1671378493}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965751398', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1652, 'last_played': 1578009708}
review:
Si vous pirater le jeu vous serai bloquer d'ans le premier ascenseur pour changer de groupe de niveaux.
Moi je n'ai pas piraté le jeu, je ne suis pas bloqué dans l'ascenseur, mais l'ascenseur a un bug et ne veux pas monter, car il croit qu'il est déjà au rez-de-chaussée
De plus j'ai un problème sur ma main gauche, quand je la retourne j'ai un gros carré noir qui apparait au lieu des informations sur les pièces que j'ai obtenu.

j'ai supprimer tous les fichiers su mon pc, désynchronisé les sauvegardes, désinstaller et réinstallé le jeu, mais sauvegarde réapparaisse et les bug reste.

beaucoup d’effort pour pouvoir jouer aussi longtemps que si j’avais pirater le jeu.

"""pour l'ascenseur j'ai trouvé la solution: il faut appuyer sur le bouton avec l'ongle du doigt."""

author: {'steamid': '76561198078457883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 1715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1278, 'last_played': 1548093407}
review:
Edit after finishing:  This is going down as one of the best games I've played.  It fits VR like a glove and has great controls and movement.  Wish I got it much sooner than I did.
Original:  It has great environments and looks great in VR.  The puzzle mechanics work really well and it's awesome to be able to pick up the different puzzle parts to place them yourself.  Very relaxing atmosphere and a deep well thought out story.  Well done Croteam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015668388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1545340583}
review: I own the 2D version and I bought this on sale for $6. It is not worth it. It's terribly optimized so performance is bad. It stutters. No option to rebind controls. Pickup is with trigger, and worse jumping is with grips. Jumping with grips on oculus results in being afraid to fully hold the controller to avoid the many accidental presses. This can be fixed with Steam Input config but that kind of stuff shouldn't be necessary. I now have to use grips for in menu selection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055890746', 'num_games_owned': 1440, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1550641237}
review:
I wasn't 100% sold on the vanilla version.

As far as im concerned, VR is the only way to experience this. When I stood before the tower, it was so beautiful that I fell to my knees and cried. 

Controls are spot on. Not many VR games give you liberty to adjust most of the control scheme, but TTP is so simple and set up in such a way that doing anything just feels natural

As for the meat and potatoes, I don't think these guys need MY affirmation on how good the puzzles and game is as a whole

author: {'steamid': '76561198864412435', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1621699607}
review: the slow paced puzzle gameplay works amazingly in VR

author: {'steamid': '76561198066519590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1579343194}
review:
In short, if you want a smooth and fairly polished puzzle solving experience in VR and haven't bought the base game I highly recommend this at any price, else definitely worth it on sale!

After playing 40 odd hours of the non VR version of the game and it's DLC's, seeing this game on sale for 8 bucks AUD, for me it was a must buy! 
This game is amazing in VR, and although I am totally against its full price tag if you've already played the original, I highly recommend picking it up on sale as it's hands down the smoothest and most enjoyable puzzle solving VR experience I've ever had.

Also, for those of you complaining about movement speed, I'm not sure if it's a bug or not, but on the occulus rift holding down the jump trigger on both the left and right controllers will mute sound and send everything in game, including your movement speed, into fast forward by what feels like a good x2-x3, which definitely helps when you want to get back to an area quickly after dying and you're not at risk of missing dialogue in the process.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071445596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1706864262}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043226817', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1554660439}
review: The VR game is a perfect port of the original game. The immersion is very high and tho its only a puzzle game in VR its double the fun. The base game has a captivating story and upholds the excitement up until the endgame. The story of the expansion is not that funny, but ok. The game is good too to test some graphics APIs; in windows I can set the max scale factor of the VR to 2,0x on DX11 and DX12. With Vulkan tho on Linux I can go up until 3,0x before it starts lagging. Max setting is 4,0x what would need a 1080. With my 1060 tho in Linux and 3,0x its perfect, already beautiful @ 2,0x.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018686466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1544582091}
review: Talos Principle is even better in VR than my previous non-VR experience. Being able to teleport around the map is so much more convenient than walking back and forth to find the solution; and the ability to move your body around to examine angles and positioning is better than anything that you could do with a controller. It's one of the best VR games that I've played and fits the gameplay perfectly. And thankfully, the development team did an excellent job creating such a polished experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071253972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1510126092}
review:
Loved the game when it came out to PC, loved it even more in VR.

Being able to walk around the world and interact with the puzzles in VR is amazing. The developers did a fantastic job by providing so many locomotion options.

The VR version also includes the DLC version, so this is a great deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037348917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1524257207}
review:
Lightly edited from my non-VR version review

What if... God was real?

But instead of wanting you to be nice to other people, there were no other people and instead He wanted you to mess with Tetris™ pieces in order to live forever?

That is the terrifying premise of The Talos Project. It is the best game of [strike]2014[/strike]2017[strike], or at least this December[/strike].
As shown in the promo images, this game also features two of my favorite things:

• Being a robot
• Petting a cat!!!

I've always wanted to be a robot, so it's pretty neat that I can do that in the game. No cats though! (Update: I found a cat, but I couldn't pet it :((( )

[spoiler]You can pet the cat![/spoiler]

It reminds me a little of the Mac game Marathon because of all the computer terminals. But in that game, you couldn't see if your hand were human hands, so if you were a robot or a cyborg was a mystery. The Talos Principal is better, because you can tell you are a robot right away, it's like the first thing that happens. Also, in the game you can type much faster and more accurately than I can in real life. I guess that's a third awesome feature!

• Typing quickly and accurately

I haven't finished yet, but if you like platform puzzles, reading about the nature of existence (Actual Kant excerpts in game, for real), and thinking about how sad the apocolypse is going to be, this is the game for you.

I give The Tavros Principle 10/10 "sigils" (Although it didn't manage to find the eleventh secret sigil)

PS: Dog is fine!

PPS: This includes Gehenna DLC?!? Crazy amount of value all-around. And for WMR folks, it includes graphics options for saturation and contrast that make the LCD HMDs look much better than by default.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017898795', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1591011690}
review:
Ich war sehr erfreut als ich gesehen habe dass The Talos Principle jetzt auch als VR zu erhalten ist und habe im Grunde genommen gar nicht überlegt und es einfach gekauft. 
The Talos Principle hat mich schon als nicht-VR verblüfft. Obwohl das Croteam ja eigentlich mehr für das Wegballern von bösen Aliens in allen Serious Sam Titeln verantwortlich ist, welche ich übrigens auch sehr gerne gespielt habe, zeigt The Talos Principle eine überraschende Tiefe. Dabei geht es erstaunlicherweise gar nicht um das eigentliche Spiel welches durch seine durchaus anspruchsvollen Knobelaufgaben dazu reizt sich haufenweise Nächte ohne Schlaf um die Ohren zu hauen, sondern um die philosophisch angehauchte Hintergrundstory die sich in vielen Puzzlestücken langsam zu einem vollständigen Bild entwickelt.
Und ähnlich wie bei Serious Sam ist auch hier die VR-Variante sehr überzeugend. Dabei kann ich gar nicht sagen woran das genau liegt, aber wenn man eigenlich nur mal in das Spiel rein schauen möchte und dann kurz darauf merkt dass schon über eine Stunde um ist dann ist das meines Erachtens ein Zeichen dafür dass die Entwickler irgendetwas richtig gemacht haben. Offensichtlich hat das Croteam bei der Umsetzung auf VR ein gutes Händchen. Ich freue mich auf jeden Fall darauf in der nächsten Zeit einige Dinge in The Talos Principle VR auszuprobieren die ich in der nicht-VR Variante bisher nocht nicht gemacht habe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348862196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 8876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2791, 'last_played': 1703715573}
review:
撃ち合いゲームは好きじゃない。そんな人におすすめ。
パズルゲームですが世界観が素晴らしい。
明らかに地球では無いがどこか地球に似た感じのパラレルワールド？
異世界感が凄く雰囲気が素晴らしい。
この手の探索型アドベンチャーゲームって一人で移動してて寂しくなったりするが
このゲームはそんな事が全然無いのが素晴らしい。
私がＶＲ機買って酔いに辟易していた初期に出会ったゲーム。
テレポート移動が選べて、ＶＲ機購入後初めて1時間以上ぶっつづけでプレイしたゲーム。
パズルはじっくり腰を据えて考えられます。（急かされない）
30面位解いたが（18年11月20日現在）5面位は反射神経が必要な面があったかな。
難易度は程よいって言うか頭を使えばどうにかなるパズル。理不尽に解けないってのは無い。
詰まっても考えに考え抜けばきっと解がみつかります。
年配の方にもおすすめしたい。ＶＲ機買ったら何よりも先にこれやっとけって位素晴らしいゲーム。（私はこのゲームに出会うまで遠回りしたので、もっと早くから出会っておけばよかったって思いましたね。）
撃ち合い、殺し合いが好きなら別の選択肢もあると思いますが。
撃ち合い、殺し合いを否定しているわけでは無くて合わないんですよね昔から。途中で飽きちゃうと言うか。

author: {'steamid': '76561197998105594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1541197315}
review: The only reason I'm not recommending this game is because there is a bug with the elevator and you can't leave the first area because of it. When you try to press the button it kinda freaks out and then nothing. I'm not sure if its just the VR controls not working properly with the buttons or the the anti-piracy feature with the elevators, but apparently it is not working correctly if it's preventing people who have a legit copy of the game from progressing. I would suggest buying the regular version of this game as it is less likely to have bugs like this, taking that its the VR controls that cause this issue. Another minor annoyance was that when you were interacting with the terminals your face is really close to the keyboard and it causes the text on the dialog options to become blurry and extremely difficult to read.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176315502', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1547317122}

from in the beginning, you want to now whats in the end.
this is a very relaxing game, and what I said earlier, you can lose track of time. so be carefull.
I recommend this game, even at full price!!! btw, this is the only game I would recommend even at full price. but if you are Like me, wait for a steam sale, you won't be disappointed ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198100189445', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1529212253}
review:
Really bad... Please people, try to design the game for  a decent VR experience if you are going to charge for it. It's not as simple as strapping the camera to the players face and handing them some shit ass controls, and voila! A sellable VR title!

I really wanted to like this game, but it physically hurts to play it, and I couldn't do it for long after a couple tries.

Try to make it better than bad. Because I would imagine that the non-VR version of the game is pretty good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968143401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1793, 'last_played': 1700349295}
review:
The Talos Principle VR est une oeuvre d'art philosophique et métaphysique qui donne aux jeux vidéos toute la splendeur qu'ils peuvent avoir. Intelligent, ne prenant jamais de raccourcis faciles, savant mélange d'espoir et de désespoir, agrémenté de pics d'humour et d'humanité toujours bien pensés.
Cherchant à vous malmener pour votre bien, dans une direction artistique toute trouvée pour ce qu'il propose, Talos ne veut pas juste vous raconter une histoire d'un futur anticipé, il veut que vous vous racontiez quelque chose à vous-même, en transposant certaines de ses recherches de la vérité et de l'inéluctabilité à votre quotidien. Bien plus qu'un jeu d'énigmes bien foutu, c'est avant tout et surtout un périple dont vous sortirez grandi. Vous pouvez retrouver l'intégralité de ma critique sur le site ETR.fr

author: {'steamid': '76561198057680429', 'num_games_owned': 1126, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1536676585}
review:
I have never played The Talos Principle before. I am a huge fan of puzzle games. The Witness and Portal 2 are two of my favourite games of all time.

This isn't as nice looking as The Witness, and the puzzles might not be of the same creativity, but it is a great quality title so quench your Puzzling needs.
It takes a bit before the puzzles starts getting tricky, but it is worth it. Contrary to The Witness, this game has you unlocking new mechanics every now and then, which keeps the portal-esque gameplay feeling fresh.
The controls takes a bit getting used to, but it is really intuitive once you get the hang of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971078343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1536233620}
review:
I loved the game on the flat screen and was looking forward to playing in VR.

Unfortunately the port to VR made the game both difficult to play and unenjoyable, mostly due to the movement mechanics. This is the only VR game I have played that has induced nausia for me, and I have played other open world games without issue.

The game is graphically wonderful, and I was really hoping to use this as one of the examples of what VR can deliver when I have friends over to try my VR setup, but with the movement mechanics as they are at the moment, I would not do so.

Due to the poor porting I would not recommend the game in its current state.

(Reviewed using a Vive Pro system)

author: {'steamid': '76561198096220624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1583569094}
review: Vast and deep, fun puzzles and great narrative. Sometimes the puzzles are super simple, some take a little brainpower, and some make you want to open youtube and watch a tutorial because the last 30 minutes you spent trying to solve it isn't working.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977427464', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1570901452}
review:
If you haven't tried The Talos Principle and want to give it a go in VR, it's all here. You can do it.

It's a port, though, not built for VR, and it shows. It breaks some rules: get too close to a wall and it'll push you back, which can be very unsettling. Step down a ledge or up onto a step and it pushes you up or down, which might be even worse. The purple semi-transparent level barriers that are fine to walk through in 2D are disturbing and difficult to walk through in room-scale.

It has a good sense of scale, which is fine until you grab a jammer that's big enough to intersect with your actual body unless you hold it at arm's length, which is awkward and creepy. If you want to primarily walk by flipping your space around to line up with where you want to go - which can be really immersive - instead of blinking everywhere or using smooth locomotion, the locomotion options aren't super well-suited for that. It allows changing the distance covered by a snap turn, but you can't both cross a field (180 degree turns) and turn corners (90 degree turns) with a low number of turn presses without going back into the menu.

It's definitely still pretty, has a good sense of wide-open space. I was able to get down on the ground and stare at where the grass didn't meet up with the (beautiful and bumpy) brick wall, which was interesting.

The conversion is top notch. Lots of settings to play with for GPUs of different capabilities. I like the feeling of being in Roman ruins, which seem pretty authentic to me. Love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975390135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1614426071}
review:
A fantastic puzzle game with a great story now playable in VR, this game acts as a beginners guide to philosophy and takes you through age old questions and possible answers. This is done through an easy to follow methodical order paced masterfully throughout the game. Between puzzles you will debate philosophy with the computer via multiple choice answers and in doing so unlock further dialogue which intertwines with the main story of the game. Worth playing either in or out of VR.

Graphics - Pretty good, can be a little grainy but overall good. 
Music - Absolutely Amazing and wonderfully atmospheric.
Gameplay - Puzzles start off simple and gradually become a challenge, combined with the music and setting the atmosphere of sitting trying to work out a puzzle is very satisfying which is only enhanced in VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996398849', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1532294926}

author: {'steamid': '76561198105133275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1530480600}
review:
I am genuinely surprised that this game has been rated so high. I think I know the problem:

VR is a new gimmick and as far as VR games go, it is OK. It's a puzzle game that at best might be worth £4.99. The problem is that the cost they are asking for this game (£30) is what you can get a AAA game for, remember this game is not new. You are paying a ridiculous amount of money for a game that is about 8 assets just copied and pasted into different levels. It's not bad, just in no way is it worth anything near the asking price. These devlopers think that because VR is a relatively new addition to gamers, they can charge what they want for mediocre looking games. 

Put it this way; I got Skyrim VR for £30 and it's phenomenal. Echo Arena is FREE and is so much more interactive and better than this. Now I think of it, I am getting a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198802957428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 1205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1164, 'last_played': 1602773741}
review:
非VR版は未プレイ

最初の数ステージはこのアイテムはこう使うんだよってチュートリアルみたいなものですかね
中盤以降になるとぐっと難度あがります。砂漠のあたりから
ふよふよしてる黒い物体にあたるとチェックポイントからやり直しになるのが結構面倒です
早送りが両手のグリップなので、解除したとたんに移動が認識されて行きたくもない特攻させられてしまったり

ピポパな端末は日本語訳だとボタンから文字はみ出して読めないことも

VRでプレイしてると解法に気づきにくいんじゃないかなと思うところや、手に持ったアイテムがトリガー押してるのに離れずに球体に襲われてやり直しとか

VR版は一部マップの変更があるんですかね？

テトリスみたいなパズルは、各扉やアイテム等の解除に毎回でてくるのでちょっと面倒

不満点ばかり書きましたが、綺麗な世界に浸る（ゾンビに襲われない）安心感、難解なステージ解けた時の達成感、新しいステージへ進む期待感
それらが高水準でまとまっており、値段以上の価値があります

author: {'steamid': '76561197993618549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2383, 'last_played': 1530152903}
review:
Don't buy the VR version. The normal version is probably pretty good though.

Because:
- Only a small percentage of the gameplay lends well to VR. Mostly it's standing around thinking. I can do that much more effectively without standing/sitting in the middle of the room with an HMD on.
- Certain puzzles are not solvable with normal VR locomotion.
- You may miss solutions to puzzles because of defects in the input system.
- You might go look up a solution and still struggle to accomplish a task that would probably be much easier without VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001872864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1523817909}
review:
I give The Talos Principle VR (Oculus Rift) 4.5/5 stars. This is quite a unique game with good graphics, nice atmosphere, somewhat challenging puzzles (and a lot of them). They even mix in some philosophy which I find is interesting and unique.

Areas for improvement:
1. Perhaps give the option to run or sprint - I find walking too slow
2. This game sometimes makes me feel nauseous after a long session - and I don't feel this way in too many other games. It's not bad though, fairly minor and only happens after an hour or two playing. 
3. Nothing else really - good puzzle game!

Positives:
1. Graphics are great
2. There are tons of puzzles, and they vary in difficulty. There are many different elements introduced to the puzzles over time
3. I like the computer terminals where you can read various philosophical writings and backstory

Bottom line: A must have for fans of puzzle games (like Portal). Pick up the Croteam pack when it's on sale - it's an amazing deal and you would also get the Serious Sam Games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058254363', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1611390919}
review:
Хоть The Talos Principle VR стоит по сумме как отдельная игра (а должна по логика быть дополнением за несущественную плату), портировали игру в VR весьма качественно, не считая, что тексутры на дали не прорисовываются, а появляются только тогда, когда начнешь приближаться к ним. 
Я прошел оригинальный The Talos Principle с DLS без гугла и ютубов, а в VR очень сильно чувствуется эффект присутствия, окружения, та же великолепная музыка и Элохим с закадровым голосом :з 
10/10 сигилов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066590240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2800, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1529302788}
review:
[h1] Experienced on the Oculus Rift with Touch Controllers [/h1]

One of the best VR experiences currently available. Even if you're not a fan of puzzle games, you will enjoy the immersion into this VR philosophical world questioning existence. There's a tactile feel to puzzles when you use motion controllers and can look around and be in the puzzle, not just see it on a screen.

This is a complete game. Your mileage will vary, but expect anywhere from 10-20 hours in this game. Puzzles start simple and slowly but surely get more complicated the further you go. You learn as you go on, like a child. The voice of God is well done and brings atmosphere to the puzzles. There's also a story to piece together by going to the terminals and input is done well by just touching the highlighted areas.

I already owned Talos Principle non-VR version and I'm so happy they brought this to VR. It just feels like a natural fit. I would say it's still worth purchasing even if you played this before. However, I do recommend changing the default controls. Enable full locomotion, smooth turning, and turn off comfort mode for the best VR experience. 

Rate 8.5/10. The best pure puzzle experience in VR (non-escape room).

author: {'steamid': '76561198043858622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1551632003}
review: Sehr interessantes Puzzlespiel mit athmosphärischen Umgebungen und interessanten philosophischen Einstreuungen. Der VR Aspekt unterstützt die räumliche Orientierung in dem Spiel und da das Spiel meist keine schnelle Reaktionen erfordert, kann man sich auch nicht in dem Vive Kabel verheddern.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971765334', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1527459687}
review:
One of the best more serious VR experiences out there. A must buy if you like first person puzzle games such as The Witness, Myst, Portal 1 and 2.

The narrative and philosophy is deep if you want it to be (accessed through optional terminals found throughout the world), based around what it means to be a person in a world of AI. If you like West World, you'll love this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016817086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1526852302}
review:
Игра хорошая, но 700 руб. как-то дороговато..
Я покупал набором "CROTEAM VR Bundle" вышло дешевле.
Не знаю как описать свои впечатления в VR, но эта игра привычнее и скорее правильнее проходит в обычном режиме у монитора...
В VR картинка далеко не идеальна. Красиво, без спорно...но у монитора было лучше. Да и глаза не болели, как это происходит в VR.
Всё равно игра хороша. Так же порадовала полная руссификация. Длинный увлекательный сюжет и головоломки не заставят Вас скучать.
Вообщем и целом - только хорошие впечатления.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998442796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1524427281}
review: A lot like Portal, minus the comedy. First levels are full of that "I solved it, I'm a genius" feeling, later levels are "ouch, my brain hurts", followed by "wait, the walkthrough said to do what again? Even the walkthroughs are at too high a difficulty level."

author: {'steamid': '76561197980514952', 'num_games_owned': 1936, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1514243252}
review:
Test réalisé en français et en anglais:

1/ Croteam a fait à nouveau du bon travail en portant l'un de ses titres phares en VR: The Talos Principale se porte à merveille au sein du casque VR. Sans aucun doute l'un des meilleurs jeu du genre à faire en réalité virtuelle.
Parfaitement optimisé pour tous les casques: Vive, Rift et Windows Mixed Reality.
Bien joué!

17/20

2/ Croteam has done yet another excellent job of bringing one of its past successes to VR; The Talos Principle feels right at home inside your headset. This is absolutely one of the best puzzle games to play in VR right now.
Perfectly optimized for all headsets: Vive, Rift, WMR.
Good job!

17/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198114960835', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1676, 'last_played': 1553468053}
review: I... It just takes the words out of my mouth. This is a really fun and Immersive game. I would get headaches from the puzzles being hard but fun. It has feelings, it has puzzles, it has everything you would want in a sparked puzzle game thats hard and story telling all at the same time. The amount of endings that allow things to be revealed. The pure fact is that this game is a game that will fill you with questions and doubt about thoughts and some things. This is the game that gives questions but hard to know answers. The other thing I wish for is more DLC if possible. I mean the game is super long and awesome but I just wish that there was more of it to go around. I always get sad that I finish a really good game because most of the time a really good game allows me to connect with the characters and everything around it. The Talos Princple did the best at this. I felt very connected with The Serpent and Elohim and the puzzles. I finished the game after like a few months because the puzzles always got at me. If you like Puzzle, Scfi, and Story telling games, this is the best game to choose

author: {'steamid': '76561198027309793', 'num_games_owned': 555, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1545040995}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009816209', 'num_games_owned': 709, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1533936955}
review: I loved this game, it's a puzzle game and a port of the pancake version but it's really great in VR. The difficulty curve is amazing, it's always getting harder but you don't feel like any single puzzle is much harder than the last, so you keep trying until you get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007808181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1510347887}
review:
This game works well with VR input.  Never played the desktop version but the difficulty in puzzles start simple and slowly ramp up.  There's also collectable stars which act as a secondary collection objective.  These take some creative thinking, some luck in finding them, a much more difficult puzzling experience, and overall a much more rewarding experience once you collect them.

The narrative to the story also adds to the whole immersion of the game.  A good purchase if you enjoy puzzles.  Can't say anything about the replayability if you played the desktop version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066632332', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 5632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3907, 'last_played': 1689814639}

author: {'steamid': '76561198152514993', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 1922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1549284831}
review:
[h1]类型[/h1]
VR，关卡式解谜，探索

[h1]游戏方式[/h1]
使用诸如干扰器、棱镜、激光、方块等等工具来解开迷宫拿到拼图。

[h1]内容[/h1]
是非VR版游戏的完整复刻，自带地狱之路DLC。
关卡非常多，没有注意统计，但肯定上百了，再加上隐藏的星星关卡，还有一些文件收集，作为参考，我的非VR版游戏时间是47h。制作者也明白塔洛斯存在关卡过多的问题，所以没有把关卡做成线性的，一般在一定阶段的时候，可以自由选择先进行哪个关卡后进行哪个关卡。
根据关卡的完成情况和玩家的选择，游戏本体一共有3种结局。

[h1]特色[/h1]
塔洛斯自带两个版本的中文音频（普通话+广东话），画面精美，还含有一些关于哲理问题的探讨（主要集中在文字上，我不喜欢这种闷头看文的形式）。
游戏内提供了四种移动方式，传送、步进、滑动（传统显示屏3D游戏的经典移动方法）、目的地跑动。非VR版的塔洛斯是当时我唯一晕过的3D游戏，在VR中为了避免这个问题制作者还是费了一番心思的。
1.传送：点哪儿立即就传送至该地；
2.步进：每次以传送的方式移动一步的距离；
3.滑动：不知道有些游戏是为了适配尽量多的VR设备还是单纯制作者想当然，将VR中的前进方向和视角方向做成一致的，操作起来极其难受，不便于移动时观察环境。塔洛斯则是将移动方向与手指着的方向保持一致，头可以灵活观察四周。可能考虑到显卡加载速度的原因，采用滑动形式移动时，只有中间视野是实时更新的，其余视野被模糊掉了。
4.目的地跑动：指定一个移动地点后，玩家会看到自己跑过去的过程。

[h1]感想[/h1]
塔洛斯的本体我是一直不怎么感冒的，虽然它制作精良，但是本体难度偏简单、关卡过多，隐藏要素又很不友好。地狱之路DLC是这部游戏真正的精华所在，极为具有挑战性的关卡，将道具的本质解析得淋漓尽致，尤其是终极星星关卡。
不过这次玩了VR版后看法有很大改观，从前嫌弃觉得是食之无味的鸡肋的精致画面（太花了太绕了以致经常因为找东西而卡关，特别是星星关卡），现在在VR版中是真正让人感受到舒适和可以欣赏的东西了，配上中文版埃洛希姆娓娓道来的磁性嗓音，玩起来是一种享受，有点像回到小时候在草地上探险的感觉。

[b]总之，如果玩家觉得关卡重复比较多玩起来太单调，可以直接转入地狱之路DLC，这个DLC是我作为一名解谜爱好者最推崇的四个解谜游戏之一（另外三个分别是环绕走廊、传送门故事：梅尔、史蒂芬的香肠卷），相信它的精彩不会让玩家失望的！[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025692762', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1534200646}
review:
A great VR port of a great game. Although not a native to VR game, the shear love Croteam put into porting this game into VR contrasts sharply to other developers (looking at you, Bethesda). Although some carryovers from the flat game can be a mild nuisance, such as being only able to carry one thing at a time, correcting those would require reworking gaming mechanics. It's a port, but a damn good one.

PS: take a stroll through the settings before you play, there is a happy abundance of movement options, and on my system the game was doing some odd things with autodetecting my graphic quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239163744', 'num_games_owned': 997, 'num_reviews': 1716, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1524311289}
review: Croteam сделал потрясающую работу по переносу этой игры в vr, и она показывает. Она работает гладко и представляет собой взрыв для решения всех головоломок, которые есть в игре. Вот как эта игра предназначена для игры, похоже, что она была сделана для VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010007942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2855, 'last_played': 1521218729}
review:
I would never have played The Talos Principle if it hadn't been a VR game. I probably should have, as it is a fantastic game. Maybe VR is not necessary in order ot play it, but I wouldn't want to exchange the immersion of being there for anything! Runs beautifully and is probably the best single player game I have ever played. A game that really makes you think on many levels - both in order to solve puzzles and about your life in general.
A must play game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071471448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1521402105}
review: Croteam did an amazing job porting this game to vr and it shows. It runs smoothly and is a blast to solve all the puzzles the game has in store. This is the way this game is meant to be played, it feels like it was made for vr. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197983750185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1523119202}
review:
not that polished
but there are a lot of settings to fine tune locomotion, and the devs are very active and supportive
it looks pretty nice in VR, cant wait to finish the game!
i tried all the different options and for me BLINK teleportation works the best, FYI

author: {'steamid': '76561198040802925', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1626861184}
review:
Проходил еще в плоской версии, где-то с год назад. 
Потом купил вр-бандл от Креотима, в основном, ради Семов, ну и недавно запустил Талоса. Глянуть, как оно в VR.

Что могу сказать - в VR перенесено качественно. На выбор для перемещения - телепорт или полноценный локомоушен.  Плавные повороты так же присутствуют. Играть заметно интереснее, чем просто на пк, + как-то проще. Или потому, что помнишь часть загадок, или потому что высматривать решение становится удобнее. 3D на уровне, атмосфера тоже. Читать текст с мониторов весьма удобно, так же как и клацать по кнопкам руками. 

Никаких глюков или тормозов - играю на CV1 + тачи, GTX 1060 на 6 гигов и старый AMD Phenom II X4 965.

Про саму игру что говорить - это головоломка в стиле "Портала", если вам нравится такое - покатит. Те, кто пишет, что игра скучная - ну, это просто не ваш жанр. Мне-то и плоская версия вполне себе понравилась.

За пару вечеров полностью прошел первый мир, надо будет как-то ее доиграть, но там Скайрим вышел, хз, когда я в нее вернусь)

Мой видео-обзор:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wCSRwUs5Ews

author: {'steamid': '76561198394748014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1541817505}
review: Can't play game at all, even with the latest updates.  "An error occurred during license verification. Make sure you're connected to the Internet and try again." Sent a message to support (support@croteam.com) and never received a response.  Requested a refund from Steam, but they said no since I bought the game in the winter sale, but waited more than 2 weeks to start playing it.  Great service all around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008299258', 'num_games_owned': 822, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1709403727}
review: Croteam first impressed me decades ago with Serious Sam, and they’ve been doing great things in the VR community, so I definitely had to check this one out. Totally different than the mind-numbing action that is Serious Sam, this is a beautifully built, and addicting 3D puzzle game, I’d say in the same genre as Portal. It’s extremely well executed in VR, runs smooth, looks great, and is easy to interact with. I’m 3 hours in, and some of the puzzles are getting pretty tough, and I’m starting to unlock new items, and pieces of the back story. I’m looking forward to seeing where this is going, and I definitely recommend this game to anyone looking for a triple-A VR puzzle game. Thumbs: UP!

author: {'steamid': '76561198109982203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1205, 'last_played': 1576928719}

Intéressent, s’adapte bien à la VR.
Longue durée de jeux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008751762', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1519775077}
review: fun on pc but NOT for vr. Blurry

author: {'steamid': '76561198017878723', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1519183768}
review:
这游戏有非VR版，但是我没玩过，有什么区别我不知道。

试玩了约半小时，除了瞬移做得不够好，偶尔会出现位置不对的情况，也不是非常影响游戏体验，暂时未发现其他问题。

这游戏主要是解密，所以不会有太大的动作需要。单手柄就能完成操作，你甚至可以坐着玩（站着玩只有手在动真没什么乐趣，腰还疼）。

既然是从非VR移植过来的，相信也不会有什么特别为VR设计的关卡，因此如果你有非VR版的话，不建议购买这个。如果你像我一样对VR在运动上有什么需求的话，这个游戏显然也不太适合你。但是无论怎么说，这个价格确实适合这么多关卡的解密游戏，还是值得的。

author: {'steamid': '76561197993472726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 8321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2449, 'last_played': 1704658311}
review:
This game is nothing short of amazing. I loved the "flat screen" version of the game so when getting into VR I had no hesitation to buy it again to get the experience of being there myself. Awesome gameplay and story along wiht great controls and immersion.

Rating: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198151698868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1534255224}
review:

そうすれば、CV1 だけじゃなくてDK2 でも遊べるんですけど。
グラフィックが綺麗なので、歩いているだけでも楽しいです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198124393444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1682183265}
review: Davvero un bel gioco, mi sta tenendo incollato al visore per ore. Alla lunga i rompicapo sembrano un po' tutti uguali, però procedendo con il gioco cambiano completamente le ambientazioni, anche la sezione egiziana mi ha stupito... Lo consiglio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138955313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1382, 'last_played': 1707754184}
review: Truly a msterpiece, we need more games like this, one of the best games i have ever played, the soundtrack is incredible, solving the puzzles is so satisfiying, and its fun unlocking new areas, and getting higher in the tower, i can't wait for the sequel. This game being in VR is amazing, i felt so immursed in the game, definitely the best of the best when it comes to VR games, nothing els like it. Also there is so many options for controls, tops other vr games

author: {'steamid': '76561197982341070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1514349380}
review: Not overly impressed with this game so far. I have only played for 2.3hrs at this point. The graphics are great and you can really get a sense you are in the game but the puzzles are kind of boring and repetitive to me. Maybe there is more to it and I am too quick to judge but I havent rushed to play more as im having a hard time finding the desire to play. Really surprised this game has so many WOW reviews. Probably wouldnt buy it again if given the chance and most likely wont play it again until after I have no other games to play. I can see this game never being finished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358207610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1645803069}
review: I played this on PS4 and it was great, not so much in VR. A total let down. wish i could get my money back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970540567', 'num_games_owned': 871, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1958, 'last_played': 1574218522}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960359910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1517260440}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018195459', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1536001458}
review: Top review nailed it. I owned the original and expansion before I bought the VR version. I wish every company would take Croteam's lead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991581948', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1519518128}
review: Played through 95% of the original flat version, then I got my vive and started playing mostly VR games and Talos started gathering dust in my library. When I saw this was available as a VR version I flip-flopped about buying it, then picked it up during the winter sale. Very happy I did, even opted out of importing my almost complete save from the flat version and am playing through from scratch. Wonderfully executed port to vr. Everything just feels right. Even pressing buttons in the terminal somehow feels like actually pressing buttons. Its been a while since I took off my headset and had to blink for a while to remember I was actually in my office. Well done Croteam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060566692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1516131453}
review: This is a very polished and feature complete VR port. It's very atmospheric too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065517086', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1514797328}
review: Playing a puzzle game like this in VR is VERY cool. Gives you a whole different spacial awareness for your puzzle solving, and it's much lower intensity than most VR games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120018884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1791, 'last_played': 1702313150}
review:
This is actually my first VR game that I've spent more than a week with since I've bough HTC Vive more than a year ago! Absolutely loved it! The concept of puzzle game with philosophical theme is a brilliant idea for a Vive. Talos Principle allows for a a lot of configuration be it a locomotion movement or AA settings and such. You can modify a lot of things including your height, which is very useful and should be done only once, in the beginning.
The story is told by the Voice and a lot of things must be deduced from the surroundings, I loved it very much.
Thank you Cro Team!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994401536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2219, 'last_played': 1555633480}
review:
I played the screen version and now I am playing the VR version, and I must say the VR is even better.
Sometimes the solution to puzzles comes more naturally.
The environment is particularly good to be experimented in VR. I had some cool vertigos when pursuing some stars.
The free locomotion system works great. Plenty of options to configure.
It runs flawlessly. Good fps, no crashes at all.
I give it 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964235833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1515701209}
review: Philosophical, powerful, beautifully-made game, and it fits VR like a glove. Excellent game/conversion Croteam, keep up the good work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047826312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1517815326}
review:
USEFUL INFO: The supersampling is set in the in-game options. It will not respect what you have selected in advanced settings (assuming you use those (which you should)). For some reason it defaulted to 75% for me, and I thought this game just looked like crap until I fixed it.

Otherwise, I'm enjoying this game so far. Using the teleport locomotion, plus the puzzle solving and island settings remind me heavily of Myst from back in the day. I'll update the review once I finish. One concern is that I'm not getting anything more out of playing this in VR than I would on a monitor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263701444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2415, 'last_played': 1515391496}
review:
VRでない方のTalosはプレイしていない。このVR版からプレイしている。

・VRでない版のTalosではDLCだった「Road to Gehenna（ゲヘナの道）」は、VR版では同梱されている。
・ステージは美しい。これだよ！　この[b]ゾンビとか虫とか怪物とか出てこないキレイな風景をVRで見たかった[/b]んだよ！
・パズルはやや難しく、歯ごたえがある。星まで集めるとなお難しい。100ステージほどあるが、1つとして前のステージと同じパターンで解決できるステージが存在しないパズル設計がすごい。どのステージでも今まで培った解法＋αが求められ、解けた時が気持ち良い。
・デフォルト設定だと移動はVRゲームでよくあるテレポート式だが、オプションから[VR CONTROLS]の[MOVEMENT MODE PRESET]で[CLASSIC]を選ぶと、VRコントローラのジョイスティックで[b]自由に走り回れる[/b]ようになりおススメ。ただしVR酔いも加速する（慣れないこともない）。なお走行時は視界が狭まる。描画速度の問題もあるんだろが、VR酔いを軽減する効果もあるんだろうな、たぶん。
・Oculus Touchでプレイしているが、ジャンプ用の[b]中指トリガーを両手で同時押しすると早送り[/b]になる。通常移動やエレベータの移動、Recorderでの時間稼ぎなどを早回しにできる。
・VRコントローラを持ち上げて左手の甲を見ると、甲の中央にステージをリセットするボタンと、それから各ドアやアイテムを解放するための印章収集の進捗が出てくる。
・高所から落ちてもダメージを受けたりはしないが、VRのリアルな風景を高速で落下するのはかなり怖い。何度やっても足元がすくむ。是非あなたも高いところからダイブしていただきたい。ゲームが進むとものすごく高い建物が出てくるので、そこから一気にイっていただきたい。
・あとマイン（球状の自爆ロボ）に予期しないタイミングで突撃を食らうと迫力ありすぎてビクッとする。
・それにしても２番目に難しいエンディングの、ムービーの凄まじさよ。なんかスゴいもの見たみたいな感想しか出てこない。今のところVRで見た物の中で一番素晴らしかった。

名作ゲームの、隙のないVR化である。
シューティングばかりのVRゲームに食傷気味の諸兄におすすめしたい。楽しめる。

author: {'steamid': '76561197983971988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3604, 'last_played': 1571424364}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065372468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 2524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1968, 'last_played': 1636515590}
review: This game is a masterpiece.  When I first discovered Talos Principle VR, I purchased it instantly.  Having played and loved the original, I was excited to re-visit the game and experience it from a new perspective.  As It turns out, this is hands down my favorite game of 2017 and one of my most enjoyable VR experiences to date.  Croateam just nailed it.  I have the upmost respect for them.  Some big name devs, I won’t mention names (Bethesda) are making cash grabs-porting out half assed renditions of their popular IPs, knowing good & well that they’ll hit target sales through name recognition alone. Not  Croateam.  Talos Principle VR is the result of what happens when devs actually care about creating the best experience and clearly understand what makes VR great. It is the best example of a VR port I’ve ever played- so much so that it is actually an improvement to its flat predecessor.  I can not recommend this game enough.  If you like 1st person puzzle games like Portal, chances are you will enjoy this as well.  The story has an introspective and enigmatic tone which helps drive progression.  VR mechanics are implemented thoughtfuly- only where they make sense, serving to enhance the game and improve immersion without getting in the way of the core game.  The amount of control you are given over the settings options should be standard practice for ALL VR games. It is so refreshing and nice to be given the freedom to tailor everything from locomotion and color saturation to resolution and other performance tweaks.  Lastly, the amount of content you get- it took me 33 hours for both endings- and I didn’t even get all the bonus stars -not to mention finish ‘The Road to Gehenna’ is especially generous for a VR game.  Thank you Croateam for actually caring about VR and making this incredible game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132244318', 'num_games_owned': 1113, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1514537344}
review:
To be honest i really enjoy this game but in my opinion the port to vr is very lazy and doesn't seem to add anything to the game. I would recommend playing talos principle but the vr of the game is not as polished as i would like. The scenes where you step onto the fan and you are forced to watch your character in 3rd person fly through the air is frankly stupid and ruins immersion. Multiple times while im playing i will see clips of my body in the game. It would be so much easier to just remove the body would it not? Its not like there are any reflection of your body in the water or a mirror?

Once again nothing against the game, it is enjoyable, however unless money is burning a hole in your pocket or you are really desperate for more vr games in your library i wouldn't recommend playing this Version. Save your money and your eyes and play the original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074046884', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1514562649}
review:
[h1]Too Easy, Too Obvious, Too Boring, VR Problems[/h1]
[i]The Talos Principle[/i] is perhaps the most widely revered puzzle game since [i]Portal 2[/i], but for the life of me I can't understand why. The mechanics you can make use of are so basic it's annoying: immobilizer towers just stop anything and are the only thing you can use for the first 10+ puzzles, and the other unlocked mechanics still involve just placing immmovables on the ground and don't have any sort of objects that can move outside your grip (and you can only hold one at a time for some reason even though it only takes one hand to hold anything but the cube/hexahedron). 

Many of the puzzles in the [b]green[/b] and [b]yellow[/b] difficulties require little-to-no brain effort to solve. Simply walk through the puzzle once and the solution is blatantly obvious. The [b]red[/b] difficulty puzzles are the only ones that require any real thought process to figure out. And the secret stars, which are supposed to be even harder accolades than beating [b]red[/b] puzzles, are pretty much all found as part of going through the motions of examining all your options.

As for the story, I can see that they've made an effort, but since I was spending so much time speedrunning to find a redeemably difficuly puzzle in this game before my return window closed, I wasn't able to focus on it enough to get any kind of opinion or even follow the plot. All I know is that I'm a robot in this game and that human civilization seems to have kicked the can long ago.

All of the above problems could also be considered part of the desktop version of [i]The Talos Principle[/i], but I must also complain about the VR implementation some. There is no inventory indicator for anything other than the tiles you've obtained. If you're holding something like keys, there is no inventory indicator that you have them in your posession. And why in the world are there two different movement buttons that do exactly the same thing? The touchpad and the grip buttons are both associated with movement and both are broken in some way. The touchpad-movement has about a 30% chance of working on any given click, and the grip-movement is forever barred from taking you through barriers that have been disabled. How much time in QA would it have taken to identify these issues? It only took me 10 minutes to notice them!

For the difficulty of the puzzles and the basicness of the mechanics in this game, I might recommed the desktop version for ~$10-$15. But the VR version has its own issues that make it annoying and difficult to play and very difficult for me to recommend at all. This really shouldn't have been a separate purchase from the desktop version. Maybe then I wouldn't be asking for a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025441960', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1541524690}
review:
Yeah, it's great. That said:

Forty dollars is, in my opinion, too much to ask for a three year old video game with VR support. Hardware is expensive, damnit. Not all of us can afford to drop full price on these ports. I can't even play Fallout 4 or L.A. Noire, since I have a 970 and can't afford the 400$ for a 1070.

But if you're the type of person who somehow thought sixty dollars for Fallout 4 was okay, you'll probably see this as a steal, considering the actual VR implementation is miles better. You can actually pull switches to activate them, instead of pointing and clicking. This should obviously be standard, but since FO4 VR is charting at #1 for doing less, I suppose this game is luxurious in comparison. 

Lots of great VR options. Lots of great options in general - Croteam is always good about this sort of thing. I got this game for twenty dollars, and at that price Talos VR is completely worth it if you've never played the game before, like me. 

All in all, you don't need me to tell you the game is good. I'm sure you already know that. But Talos is probably the game most suited for VR in Croteam's entire catalog.
